commit_message:
CentOS9: Use inspector-dnsmasq for TFTP server by default

The tftp-server package and the xinetd package is no longer available
since CentOS9/RHEL9.

This change ensures TFTP server of inspector-dnsmasq process us used by
default as replacement of xinetd+tftpd.

Change-Id: I2aedf7fd80d2377fc0d906f9f32171b6d1f44d0a

subject: Allow using ironic-inspector-dnsmasq for tftp server
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'tkajinam@redhat.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-26 21:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-26 21:14:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-26 21:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 03:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 03:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-28 00:10:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Ironic-inspector is an optional, non-required package, and thus a sub-package of it shouldn't become required to support base tftp operations. Heading down this path actually actually creates a more complex operational environment because the inspector dnsmasq usage is geared for purely IP address management. And while a separate TFTP target can, and in some cases does get setup for machine discovery, in most cases that can be handled without a separate service."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-28 00:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So ironic doesn't require ironic-inspector while we don't really expect usage of ironic-inspector "without ironic". Then the proper direction is not use this existing service part of inspector but create a new service in ironic.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-28 00:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Allow using ironic-inspector-dnsmasq for tftp server

This change is a prep work to support CentOS9 which doesn't provide
either tftpd or xinetd, and allow usage of ironic-inspector-dnsmasq
service to provide TFTP server instead of xinetd.

Change-Id: I5e829d504a6b5b981d8859b993934570d3341da2

[{'created': '2021-07-27 10:37:37.000000000', 'message': "Remove optional attributes from insert_media

Inserted and WriteProtected attributes are optional and have reasonable
default values. Specifying them in every insert_media call can cause
issues on BMC that do not support these and not having them should't
cause any issues. Removing Inserted and WriteProtected attributes from
insert_media payload to improve compatibility with a wider range of
BMCs.

Change-Id: Ieab097c63f218c3c262f013c29495f5393dd3cfc
"}, {'created': '2021-07-27 10:38:22.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Remove optional attributes from insert_media

Inserted and WriteProtected attributes are optional and have reasonable
default values. Specifying them in every insert_media call can cause
issues on BMC that do not support these and not having them should't
cause any issues. Removing Inserted and WriteProtected attributes from
insert_media payload to improve compatibility with a wider range of
BMCs.

Change-Id: Ieab097c63f218c3c262f013c29495f5393dd3cfc
"}, {'created': '2021-07-28 00:17:26.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Remove optional attributes from insert_media

Inserted and WriteProtected attributes to InsertMedia are optional and have
reasonable default values. Specifying them in every insert_media call can
cause issues on BMC that do not support these and not having them should't
cause any issues. Setting default values of Inserted and WriteProtected
attributes in insert_media to None payload to improve compatibility with
a wider range of BMCs.

Change-Id: Ieab097c63f218c3c262f013c29495f5393dd3cfc
"}, {'created': '2021-07-28 00:28:03.000000000', 'message': 'Change defaults - optional insert_media attributes

Inserted and WriteProtected attributes to insert_media are optional and should
have reasonable default values on the BMC side. Specifying them in every
insert_media call can cause issues on those BMCs that treat them as read-only and not
specifying these attributes at all should not cause issues.
Setting default values of Inserted and WriteProtected attributes in
insert_media to None (and hence removing them from the request payload by default)
to improve compatibility with a wider range of BMCs.

Change-Id: Ieab097c63f218c3c262f013c29495f5393dd3cfc
'}, {'created': '2021-07-28 00:30:47.000000000', 'message': 'Change defaults - optional insert_media attributes

have reasonable default values on the BMC side. Specifying them in every
insert_media call can cause issues on those BMCs that treat them as read-only and not
specifying these attributes at all should not cause issues.
Setting default values of Inserted and WriteProtected attributes in
insert_media to None (and hence removing them from the request payload by default)
to improve compatibility with a wider range of BMCs.

Change-Id: Ieab097c63f218c3c262f013c29495f5393dd3cfc

specifying these attributes at all should not cause issues.
Setting default values of Inserted and WriteProtected attributes in

commit_message:
Change defaults - optional insert_media attributes

Updating default values of 'inserted' and 'write_protected' attributes
in VirtualMedia::insert_media() to None. This is a more simple and
clear way of removing these fields from the Redfish API request payload
than the previous approach of checking these attributes are set to
defaults and if this the case removing them from payload.

Story: 2009086
Task: 42907
rhbz#1986238

Change-Id: Ieab097c63f218c3c262f013c29495f5393dd3cfc

commit_message:
[func test] move port creation to the NeutronFixture

The port resource request tests needs some extra ports and networks that
so far was created in the test class setUp(). For the pps support we need
to be able to create NeutronFixture subclass and that to work properly
first we need to encapsulate the port creation into the fixture. We also
took the opportunity to move the resulting new NeutronFixture closer to
the tests that are depending on it.

Change-Id: I85dd8a6af1486de2935b6d1c55cdfe4abf75c19b
blueprint: qos-minimum-guaranteed-packet-rate

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-24 06:46:58.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid modifying the Mock class in test

The rdb unit test defines a shutdown field on the Mock class
unintentionally. This causes that a later test in the same
executor expecting that mock.Mock().shutdown is a newly auto
generated mock.Mock() but it founds that is an already used
(called) object. This causes that the later test fails when
asserting the number of calls on that mock.

The original intention of the rbd unit test was to catch the
instantiation of the Rados object in test so it set Rados = mock.Mock()
so when the code under test called Rados() it actually called Mock().
It worked but it has that huge side effect. Instead of this a proper
mocking of the constructor can be done in two steps:

rados_inst = mock.Mock()
Rados = mock.Mock(return_value=rados_inst)

This makes sure that every Rados() call will return rados_inst that is a
mock without causing Mock class level side effect.

Change-Id: If71620e808744736cb4fe3abda76d81a6335311b
Closes-Bug: #1936849
(cherry picked from commit 930b7c992156733fbb4f598488605825d62ebc0c)
'}, {'created': '2021-08-24 15:25:15.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid modifying the Mock class in test

The rdb unit test defines a shutdown field on the Mock class
unintentionally. This causes that a later test in the same
executor expecting that mock.Mock().shutdown is a newly auto
generated mock.Mock() but it founds that is an already used
(called) object. This causes that the later test fails when
asserting the number of calls on that mock.

The original intention of the rbd unit test was to catch the
instantiation of the Rados object in test so it set Rados = mock.Mock()
so when the code under test called Rados() it actually called Mock().
It worked but it has that huge side effect. Instead of this a proper
mocking of the constructor can be done in two steps:

rados_inst = mock.Mock()
Rados = mock.Mock(return_value=rados_inst)

This makes sure that every Rados() call will return rados_inst that is a
mock without causing Mock class level side effect.

Change-Id: If71620e808744736cb4fe3abda76d81a6335311b
Closes-Bug: #1936849
(cherry picked from commit 930b7c992156733fbb4f598488605825d62ebc0c)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid modifying the Mock class in test

The rdb unit test defines a shutdown field on the Mock class
unintentionally. This causes that a later test in the same
executor expecting that mock.Mock().shutdown is a newly auto
generated mock.Mock() but it founds that is an already used
(called) object. This causes that the later test fails when
asserting the number of calls on that mock.

The original intention of the rbd unit test was to catch the
instantiation of the Rados object in test so it set Rados = mock.Mock()
so when the code under test called Rados() it actually called Mock().
It worked but it has that huge side effect. Instead of this a proper
mocking of the constructor can be done in two steps:

rados_inst = mock.Mock()
Rados = mock.Mock(return_value=rados_inst)

This makes sure that every Rados() call will return rados_inst that is a
mock without causing Mock class level side effect.

Change-Id: If71620e808744736cb4fe3abda76d81a6335311b
Closes-Bug: #1936849
(cherry picked from commit 930b7c992156733fbb4f598488605825d62ebc0c)

I think I remember this use case coming up in the design sessions.

In this case, if there is no other option than to use md5, the only thing that we can do is document that this feature cannot be used on a fips enabled environment.  I'm assuming this is an optional feature?"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-08-09 13:03:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2021-08-05 09:54:12.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo_frr: set a MD5 password

Set a MD5 password to be used with the tcp socket that is being used to
connect to the remote peer. For more information, please refer to
https://docs.frrouting.org/en/latest/bgp.html#clicmd-neighbor-PEER-password-PASSWORD

Change-Id: I0a13ebb127bb484804169d7e4930138bcb01d5a9
'}, {'created': '2021-08-20 10:45:10.000000000', 'message': "tripleo_frr: Allow a password to be set in FRR's neighbor section

Set a MD5 password to be used with the tcp socket that is being used to
connect to the remote peer. For more information, please refer to
https://docs.frrouting.org/en/latest/bgp.html#clicmd-neighbor-PEER-password-PASSWORD

Note that this is disabled by default. When enabled it won't work on a FIPS-enabled
system. FRR is already patched so that it will fail to start in such a
situation,

[1] https://git.centos.org/rpms/frr/blob/c8s/f/SOURCES/0004-fips-mode.patch

Change-Id: I0a13ebb127bb484804169d7e4930138bcb01d5a9
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo_frr: Allow a password to be set in FRR's neighbor section

Set a MD5 password to be used with the tcp socket that is being used to
connect to the remote peer. For more information, please refer to
https://docs.frrouting.org/en/latest/bgp.html#clicmd-neighbor-PEER-password-PASSWORD

Note that this is disabled by default. When enabled it won't work on a FIPS-enabled
system. FRR is already patched so that it will fail to start in such a
situation,

[1] https://git.centos.org/rpms/frr/blob/c8s/f/SOURCES/0004-fips-mode.patch

Change-Id: I0a13ebb127bb484804169d7e4930138bcb01d5a9

commit_message:
Revert "Bump Ceph container daemons to v6.0.4"

This reverts commit 76a5c4efc66f4e2b6393aef2eead53c03be43896.

Reason for revert: Since this patch ceph process consuming too much
memory and leading to job failures.

Change-Id: Iafd43b4700e3a011db67e40b9a501db3a53a81a1
Related-Bug: #1940866

commit_message:
[OSC] Implement share instance commands

Added the implementation of the share instance commands to OSC.
Commands are:

- openstack share instance delete
- openstack share instance list
- openstack share instance set
- openstack share instance show

Co-Authored-By: Luisa Amaral <luisarfamaral@gmail.com>
Partially-Implements: bp openstack-client-support
Change-Id: I8d29651d4e3a74b9ade67ea0a8f20808ca33bdc8

Leave a comment with 'run-DellEMC SC CI' to trigger a recheck. For more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_SC_CI"}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2021-08-19 20:12:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Emilien for submitting this patch. 

The patch looks good to me but I'd like to leave the concerns raised in the bug meeting this week regarding this issue. The reason we don't do this before is because the logged status could be wrong due to race conditions. Some ideas came up i.e. use conditional_update() to report the relevant values back, not query them again later.

Maybe this is not the case, I'm still reviewing this. Please feel free to ignore this comment if this is not the case."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2021-08-20 03:14:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Thanks Emilien for submitting this patch. 
> 
> The patch looks good to me but I'd like to leave the concerns raised in the bug meeting this week regarding this issue. The reason we don't do this before is because the logged status could be wrong due to race conditions. Some ideas came up i.e. use conditional_update() to report the relevant values back, not query them again later.
> 
> Maybe this is not the case, I'm still reviewing this. Please feel free to ignore this comment if this is not the case.

ack, just let me know if you want me to change anything.
even if there is a race, i think this is just for some log reporting, so this isn't as critical as it could be in other circumstances."}, {'account_id': 12670, 'date': '2021-08-20 14:08:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-08-20 16:07:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm not so sure about this.  See comment inline about possible revision.

I know that getting a message like: 'Volume status must be available or error or error_restoring or error_extending or error_managing and must not be migrating, attached, belong to a group, have snapshots or be disassociated from snapshots after volume transfer.' is really frustrating, so I sympathize with the aim of the patch."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2021-08-23 12:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2021-08-23 12:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
API/logging: improve message when a volume can't be removed

As an operator, I would like to see what is the volume state when I try
to delete it while it's in the wrong state.

The current message was telling me what should be its state, but not its
current state. This patch will fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1940437
Change-Id: I258adff33eb9699d1a2bae283b0af20e7f9abaf9

commit_message:
Simplify test_live_migration

We don't actually need guest networking for any of our live migration
tests. Remove the setup_credentials() method that sets it up.

Change-Id: Ie28461a9ad64dd02ce86d23e0f4b7766a776be9a

that'll have the same effect of giving our test instance a network
interface.

commit_message:
Improve base compute and utils helper organization

Move helpers out of base compute class that do not actually need a
test class, and create a new hardware.py file to keep helpers that
have to do with hardware.

Change-Id: I7a8ae901dce68f4d858aa2062820fd7405c87f45

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-20 05:46:22.000000000', 'message': '[ovn][metadata] connect to any southbound database

When connecting to ovsdb cluster, by default the connection is established only
against the current cluster leader, so that writes are not issued against
followers. Additionally, when cluster leader changes all clients that have
leader_only=true will then reconnect to the new leader. That puts an extra load
on the cluster, especially during leader change, and given that ovn metadata
server no longer writes anything to southbound db, we can switch leader_only to
false, and accecpt any cluster member connection.

Closes-Bug: #1940617
Change-Id: Id438434c3ee5b46c9fa6c7df1a9276b2f9f5d8c2
'}]
commit_message:
[ovn][metadata] connect to any southbound database

When connecting to ovsdb cluster, by default the connection is established only
against the current cluster leader, so that writes are not issued against
followers. Additionally, when cluster leader changes all clients that have
leader_only=true will then reconnect to the new leader. That puts an extra load
on the cluster, especially during leader change, and given that ovn metadata
server no longer writes anything to southbound db, we can switch leader_only to
false, and accecpt any cluster member connection.

Closes-Bug: #1940617
Change-Id: Id438434c3ee5b46c9fa6c7df1a9276b2f9f5d8c2

test_confirm_snapshot_based_resize_at_source_delete_alloc_fails was

patch we are reverting added the test and the test is no longer valid

revert.

Closes-Bug: #1836754

Change-Id: I277ba12a676fe8ecd77b25456d1a08c81360d64a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Consumer gen support for delete instance allocations"

This reverts commit 6f1a1f5e8ead9ceb145e13927cd9ae7fdca9add4.

Conflicts:
    doc/source/user/placement.rst
    nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py
    nova/scheduler/client/report.py
    nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py
    nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are because:

  * Placement docs moved to the openstack/placement repo around the
    time of I218a6d11fea934e8991e41b4b36203c6ba3e3dbf (Use links to
    placement docs in nova docs)

  * I1dd6abcc2be17ff76f108e7ff3771314f33259c6 (Stop handling
    'InstanceUnknownCell' exception) landed after the patch we are
    reverting

  * I1dea4472b232d6c054879ebda2536658d9769053 (Fix wrong consumer type
    in logging) landed after the patch we are reverting

  * I456f685f480b8de71014cf232a8f08c731605ad8 (Create a fixture around
    fake_notifier) landed after the patch we are reverting

  * I6daea47988181dfa6dde3d9c42004c0ecf6ae87a (functional: Add and use
    'GlanceFixture') landed after the patch we are reverting

  * Iad2e4da4546b80a016e477577d23accb2606a6e4 (db: Unify 'nova.db.api',
    'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api') landed after the patch we are reverting

  * I680f0bab766693b8cc6f0f912f0b7987a9debec9 (trivial: Remove unused
    '_instance_to_allocations_dict' function) landed after the patch we
    are reverting

NOTE(melwitt): In nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py,
test_confirm_snapshot_based_resize_at_source_delete_alloc_fails was
also removed because change I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92
(Drop legacy cold migrate allocation compat code) that landed after the
patch we are reverting added the test and the test is no longer valid
because delete_allocation_for_instance can no longer fail with this
revert.

Closes-Bug: #1836754

Change-Id: I277ba12a676fe8ecd77b25456d1a08c81360d64a

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-01-20 11:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-01-20 11:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

sounds good, if it work for your purpose!'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-01-20 11:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-01-20 13:20:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm unsure if the purpose of this patch is only for CI or if it's intended to become widely used; but I'll bring my concerns here.

This is not the documented & supported way to modify an image.
We came up with an Ansible role:
https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image

Which allows to modify, build and tag an image from different sources: rpms, repos, Dockerfile, Opendev Gerrit, etc. I'm sure you'll find a way in this role that will work for your use case.

For example if you have a list of .patch files to apply, you could easily use apply them in a Dockerfile:
https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image#modify-image

I think we should be using our modify-image role and not do these kind of shenanigans here."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-01-20 13:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs/src/branch/master/deploy-guide/source/deployment/container_image_prepare.rst'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:07:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

Also unsure if this intends to dirty-patch runtime containers in order to allow upgrades then container replacement - in such a case, it would make sense to stay with this approach.

Some use-case might help understand the need - didn't think about that modify-image role -.-'."}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-02-28 14:48:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree with what has been said, we should use tripleo-modify-image role and packages.  See an example there http://file.rdu.redhat.com/~sathlang/tripleo/osp16/workaround-osp16-pacemaker-bz1791135.yaml'}, {'account_id': 33080, 'date': '2021-06-16 12:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 33080, 'date': '2021-06-16 12:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2021-06-16 13:17:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Slight typo in the test file and hardcoding the name of the updated file would be better IMHO.

This is really the weak point of this, we don't have a robust way to update those file.

As it's tripleo-upgrade that create them, maybe we can do better than just trying to update them with awk/sed/grep and directly generate the appropriate files there ? Something worth investing I think."}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2021-06-18 12:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2021-06-30 15:38:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

I've got just few nits. I would like to give the patch a try in my local environment to give you better feedback, but it looks good so far"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2021-07-08 08:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 33080, 'date': '2021-08-19 12:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 33080, 'date': '2021-08-23 12:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 33080, 'date': '2021-08-23 12:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-17 16:41:16.000000000', 'message': 'Allow applying workaround patches in containers.

The current workarounds mechanism allows applying a patch
into a host, usually the Undercloud. With the containerization
of the undercloud a new need arises, the option to apply a
patch into a container or list of containers.

This patch adds a new workarounds field: containers, which consists
on a list of containers or a single container to which a
patch will be applied. After applying the patch, the corresponding
systemd service that controls the container will be restarted.
It is used in combination with the already existing fields patch,
id and basedir. Examples:
pre_undercloud_update_workarounds:
    - rhbz1:
        patch: true
        basedir: /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages
        containers: mistral_executor,mistral_engine,mistral_event_engine
        id: 112345
        command:

pre_undercloud_upgrade_workarounds:
    - rhbz1:
        patch: true
        basedir: /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages
        containers: mistral_executor
        id: 112346
        command:

Change-Id: I4f8151f003d7636c3b34158e32ee62047f008129

'}, {'created': '2021-06-30 11:20:33.000000000', 'message': 'Allow applying workaround patches in containers.

The current workarounds mechanism allows applying a patch
into a host, usually the Undercloud. With the containerization
of both undercloud and overcloud a new need arises, the option to apply a
patch into a container or list of containers.

This patch adds new workarounds field to apply modifications to overcloud or undercloud
containers using tripleo container image prepare[1]. The workaround mechanism takes a ContainerImagePrepare
file and adds desired modifications on top of it. After building containers, modified containers
parameters file are added to desired update or upgrade scripts to update TripleO Heat Templates 
before update/upgrade run. This way changes in containers are persistent. There is also field 'preparation_commands'
to execute some pre container image prepare commands, for example to download rpms or create custom Dockerfile.

pre_undercloud_update_workarounds:
    - rhbz1:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: undercloud
        preparation_commands: |
          echo "Updates undercloud containers command"
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - ironic-inspector
          modify_append_tag: "-updated"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: yum_update.yml
            compare_host_packages: true
            yum_repos_dir_path: /etc/yum.repos.d

pre_overcloud_update_prepare_workarounds:
    - rhbz11:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: overcloud
        deploy_scripts: overcloud_update_prepare.sh,overcloud_update_converge.sh
        preparation_commands: |
          echo "Updates overcloud containers command"
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - rabbitmq
          - haproxy
          - maria
          - redis
          modify_append_tag: "-updated"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: yum_update.yml
            compare_host_packages: true
            yum_repos_dir_path: /etc/yum.repos.d

Change-Id: I4f8151f003d7636c3b34158e32ee62047f008129
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/deployment/container_image_prepare.html#modifying-images-during-prepare

commit_message:
Allow applying workaround patches in containers.

The current workarounds mechanism allows applying a patch
into a host, usually the Undercloud. With the containerization
of both undercloud and overcloud a new need arises, the option to apply a
patch into a container or list of containers.

This patch adds new workarounds field to apply modifications to overcloud or undercloud containers using tripleo container image prepare[1]. The workaround mechanism takes a ContainerImagePrepare
file and adds desired modifications on top of it. After building containers, modified containers
parameters file are added to desired update or upgrade scripts to update TripleO Heat Templates before update/upgrade run. This way changes in containers are persistent. There is also field 'preparation_commands'
to execute some pre container image prepare commands, for example to download rpms or create custom Dockerfile.

pre_undercloud_update_workarounds:
    - rhbz1:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: undercloud
        preparation_commands: |
          echo "Updates undercloud containers command"
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - ironic-inspector
          modify_append_tag: "-updated"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: yum_update.yml
            compare_host_packages: true
            yum_repos_dir_path: /etc/yum.repos.d

pre_overcloud_update_prepare_workarounds:
    - rhbz11:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: overcloud
        deploy_scripts: overcloud_update_prepare.sh,overcloud_update_converge.sh
        preparation_commands: |
          echo "Updates overcloud containers command"
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - rabbitmq
          - haproxy
          - maria
          - redis
          modify_append_tag: "-updated"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: yum_update.yml
            compare_host_packages: true
            yum_repos_dir_path: /etc/yum.repos.d

#Only supports python source projects
pre_overcloud_update_prepare_workarounds:
    - rhbz11:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: overcloud
        deploy_scripts: overcloud_update_prepare.sh,overcloud_update_converge.sh
        preparation_commands: ""
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - heat-api
          modify_append_tag: "-modified"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: dev_install.yml
            source_image: docker.io/tripleomaster/centos-binary-heat-api:current-tripleo
            refspecs:
              -
                project: heat
                refspec: refs/changes/12/1234/3

Change-Id: I4f8151f003d7636c3b34158e32ee62047f008129
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/deployment/container_image_prepare.html#modifying-images-during-prepare

[{'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-04-22 10:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-04-22 10:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

adding gibi as nova ptl'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-04-22 11:49:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm wondering about a couple of things:

* The current proposal (based on other projects' usage) introduces 4 values (-1, 0, +1, +2) for this new label. Right now I don't think we need such amount of complexity. I'm wondering if we are OK with a simple 0,+1 flag. Simply +1 would mean that the core team (or some of the cores) is decided to put extra attention to the given patch. 

* The current proposal allows every core to set the flag. I like this. I expect that the core who sets this flag commits to review the marked patch. (This also prevent setting the mark on its own patch)

* Similar to the runway process here I also would like to limit the amount of stuff that can have priority at the same time. So I suggest that before you set the flag check if there are other patches already marked where you can help with the review and if so, then do that review first, before you mark a new patch as priority.

* I will add an agenda item to the weekly meeting where we look at the marked patches. So that we can have a chat about the status or decided to remove the mark if the patch stalled out.

What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-04-22 13:37:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> I'm wondering about a couple of things:
> 
> * The current proposal (based on other projects' usage) introduces 4 values (-1, 0, +1, +2) for this new label. Right now I don't think we need such amount of complexity. I'm wondering if we are OK with a simple 0,+1 flag. Simply +1 would mean that the core team (or some of the cores) is decided to put extra attention to the given patch.

ya so i was orginally going to make it 0,+1 and +2 because if we dont like semthign we can alwasy -2 the idea so negitive values seamed weird to me.

0 an +1 i think would be fine too
 
> 
> * The current proposal allows every core to set the flag. I like this. I expect that the core who sets this flag commits to review the marked patch. (This also prevent setting the mark on its own patch)

yes so just like code reviews when you leave a +p( i cant keep spelling priority right :P) 
it will put your name beside it in the ui so we can clearly see that in the ui and know who added it

multiple cores can set it like +w

> 
> * Similar to the runway process here I also would like to limit the amount of stuff that can have priority at the same time. So I suggest that before you set the flag check if there are other patches already marked where you can help with the review and if so, then do that review first, before you mark a new patch as priority.

that sounds resonable altough that is something not enforcable by gerrit :) 

setting -w until agreement is reached on the questions above."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-04-28 23:42:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

look like no one else has express an opinion.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-22 10:19:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add review priority label to nova deliverables

This change adds a Review Priority label to all nova deliverables
currently under acl control in the project config repo.

The range -1..+2 was chosen to have parity with all
existing uses fo the label for consitency.

The ablity set the new lable is granted only to the core
and stable core teams for the updated repos.

commit_message:
Add review priority label to nova deliverables

This change adds a Review Priority label to all nova deliverables
currently under acl control in the project config repo.

The ability set the new label is granted only to the core
and stable core teams for the updated repos.

Change-Id: I2fd7a6387d2f50eeeb8cef513df19b5696cce55b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-07 05:42:10.000000000', 'message': 'Allow applying workaround patches in containers.

The current workarounds mechanism allows applying a patch
into a host, usually the Undercloud. With the containerization
of both undercloud and overcloud a new need arises, the option to apply a
patch into a container or list of containers.

This patch adds new workarounds field to apply modifications to overcloud or undercloud
containers using tripleo container image prepare[1]. The workaround mechanism takes a ContainerImagePrepare
file and adds desired modifications on top of it. After building containers, modified containers
parameters file are added to desired update or upgrade scripts to update TripleO Heat Templates 
before update/upgrade run. This way changes in containers are persistent. There is also field 'preparation_commands'
to execute some pre container image prepare commands, for example to download rpms or create custom Dockerfile.

pre_undercloud_update_workarounds:
    - rhbz1:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: undercloud
        preparation_commands: |
          echo "Updates undercloud containers command"
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - ironic-inspector
          modify_append_tag: "-updated"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: yum_update.yml
            compare_host_packages: true
            yum_repos_dir_path: /etc/yum.repos.d

pre_overcloud_update_prepare_workarounds:
    - rhbz11:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: overcloud
        deploy_scripts: overcloud_update_prepare.sh,overcloud_update_converge.sh
        preparation_commands: |
          echo "Updates overcloud containers command"
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - rabbitmq
          - haproxy
          - maria
          - redis
          modify_append_tag: "-updated"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: yum_update.yml
            compare_host_packages: true
            yum_repos_dir_path: /etc/yum.repos.d

commit_message:
Allow applying workaround patches in containers.

The current workarounds mechanism allows applying a patch
into a host, usually the Undercloud. With the containerization
of both undercloud and overcloud a new need arises, the option to apply a
patch into a container or list of containers.

This patch adds new workarounds field to apply modifications to overcloud or undercloud containers using tripleo container image prepare[1]. The workaround mechanism takes a ContainerImagePrepare
file and adds desired modifications on top of it. After building containers, modified containers
parameters file are added to desired update or upgrade scripts to update TripleO Heat Templates before update/upgrade run. This way changes in containers are persistent. There is also field 'preparation_commands'
to execute some pre container image prepare commands, for example to download rpms or create custom Dockerfile.

pre_undercloud_update_workarounds:
    - rhbz1:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: undercloud
        preparation_commands: |
          echo "Updates undercloud containers command"
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - ironic-inspector
          modify_append_tag: "-updated"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: yum_update.yml
            compare_host_packages: true
            yum_repos_dir_path: /etc/yum.repos.d

pre_overcloud_update_prepare_workarounds:
    - rhbz11:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: overcloud
        deploy_scripts: overcloud_update_prepare.sh,overcloud_update_converge.sh
        preparation_commands: |
          echo "Updates overcloud containers command"
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - rabbitmq
          - haproxy
          - maria
          - redis
          modify_append_tag: "-updated"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: yum_update.yml
            compare_host_packages: true
            yum_repos_dir_path: /etc/yum.repos.d

pre_overcloud_update_prepare_workarounds:
    - rhbz11:
        patch: false
        containers: true
        environment: overcloud
        deploy_scripts: overcloud_update_prepare.sh,overcloud_update_converge.sh
        preparation_commands: ""
        containers_file_modifications:
          modify_role: tripleo-modify-image
          includes:
          - heat-api
          modify_append_tag: "-modified"
          modify_vars:
            tasks_from: dev_install.yml
            source_image: docker.io/tripleomaster/centos-binary-heat-api:current-tripleo
            refspecs:
              -
                project: heat
                refspec: refs/changes/12/1234/3

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/deployment/container_image_prepare.html#modifying-images-during-prepare

Change-Id: I4f8151f003d7636c3b34158e32ee62047f008129
(cherry picked from commit 5d1bf944d6e3c484af451499d87c5fe3a084b1ff)

commit_message:
Add klb ep handling by looking up ACTIVE ports

Endpoints can be anything, a Pod or another VM, till now Kuryr only
handled the Pod as it's known component of the cluster.

Change-Id: I3422b9f786a0decdd3053a4e17803eea4287581f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-20 17:00:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race condition retrieving logical router rows

Using rows.values() via the ovsdbapp API is inherently
racy as if there are multiple threads an add/delete can
interfere, triggering a RuntimeError (dictionary changed
size during iteration). Use db_list_rows() instead as it
avoids this issue.

Also changed the IDL notify code to use a frozen row to
similary avoid any possible race condition with there.

Change-Id: Id4e15867b61925fa157c9e81750d8c5f63ad48a5
Closes-bug: #1936959

Using rows.values() via the ovsdbapp API is inherently
racy as if there are multiple threads an add/delete can
interfere, triggering a RuntimeError (dictionary changed
size during iteration).

In one case we now directly use lookup() as we were
looking for a specific logical router.

In the other two cases we create a new class to do the
operation in a transaction, making it idempotent, since
both need to iterate the returned list.

Also changed the IDL notify code to use a frozen row to
similary avoid any possible race condition with there.

Change-Id: Id4e15867b61925fa157c9e81750d8c5f63ad48a5
Closes-bug: #1936959
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition retrieving logical router rows

Using rows.values() via the ovsdbapp API is inherently
racy as if there are multiple threads an add/delete can
interfere, triggering a RuntimeError (dictionary changed
size during iteration).

In one case we now directly use lookup() as we were
looking for a specific logical router.

In the other two cases we create a new class to do the
operation in a transaction, making it idempotent, since
both need to iterate the returned list.

Also changed the IDL notify code to use a frozen row to
similary avoid any possible race condition with there.

Change-Id: Id4e15867b61925fa157c9e81750d8c5f63ad48a5
Closes-bug: #1936959

commit_message:
Add OEM Task extension

Added to get OEM JobType to determine if rebooting is done by iDRAC
for OEM RAID jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/sushy/+/800267
Change-Id: I1c83d59f1c99f0b70fbf4f5a5d71698b76d8e975

commit_message:
Remove shim in securitygroups_db

SECURITY_GROUP and SECURITY_GROUP_RULE resources now
is using payload style callback. Shim can be removed

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-27 14:36:08.000000000', 'message': 'Setting upper constraints to wallaby branch of requirements

The upper constraints of the python dependencies were previously
set to the master as well as to the wallaby branch.

As there is a growing possibility of conflict between them,
it is preferrable to keep only one, branch accurate, version
of the constraints.

Furthermore the installation directive of the tox environment
is unnecessary, as the the dependencies can be specified
separately and pulled during environment setup.

Closes-Bug: #1941897

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6a4b23824a1969668bbd02acab9db38c0f1291e9
'}]
commit_message:
Setting upper constraints to wallaby branch of requirements

The upper constraints of the python dependencies were previously
set to the master as well as to the wallaby branch.

As there is a growing possibility of conflict between them,
it is preferrable to keep only one, branch accurate, version
of the constraints.

Furthermore the installation directive of the tox environment
is unnecessary, as the the dependencies can be specified
separately and pulled during environment setup.

Closes-Bug: #1941897

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6a4b23824a1969668bbd02acab9db38c0f1291e9

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for scheduler stats

The API for listing scheduler pools is specific to operators, so we have
to keep it to system scope only.

Change-Id: I601fdeeba3b59dcb47b84787a29cc8d4c593a5e7

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for services

The services API is specific to operators, making it a good candidate
for system-scope.

Change-Id: If85a09c76f279419bb67dfcfde294ee2fc817218

commit_message:
Release final openstacksdk for Xena

This proposed a release for openstacksdk to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 23.

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia50a671ba83d83deecefc084e352fc641dbfb45d

commit_message:
Release final neutron-lib for Xena

This proposed a release for neutron-lib to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect. We previously
announced a wrong date for the final lib series, this is a convenience
patch to allow to release latest changes before freezing the libs.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 30.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.14.0..5ff14c6
5ff14c6 Fix hostroute validation with BFD
c3f540a Disable "oslo.messaging" metrics
4c9bfc1 Add network_ip_availability pagging and sorting support
101791f Do not use deprecated attributes of RequestContext
e8b398e Add missing default "direction" value to "qos-pps-minimum"

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I69b610614abcf0f9f25a0caacc2415ae7d3e12c5

commit_message:
Bump Ceph container daemons to v6.0.4

The stable Ceph containers v16.2.5 are now released.
This change aligns the new tag with the latest released stable
content (which is v6.0.4 for the daemon images).

Depends-On: I50a683aaa7062f7f33d6de45758844c8523da7f2
Change-Id: I14142570ccb3a229fb634d13230401beb1e20c70

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-24 09:57:42.000000000', 'message': "New project: OVN BGP Agent

The OVN BGP Agent allows to expose VMs/Containers through BGP on OVN
environments.

Initially, the agent will watch the OVN databases and react to events
such as VMs being created on provider network or VMs with attached FIPs
and advertises them via BGP.

In the future we would like to integrate the agent with other projects
such as the neutron-dynamic-routing [0] and re-use it's API.

The project is being proposed under x/ because it needs to mature prior
to requesting it to be included under the Neutron Stadium Projects
umbrella [1].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing
[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ieb92d6581247f0e6f4ab87807d0a6cdb18eb448d
"}, {'created': '2021-08-24 10:16:22.000000000', 'message': "New project: OVN BGP Agent

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html

Change-Id: Ieb92d6581247f0e6f4ab87807d0a6cdb18eb448d

commit_message:
New project: OVN BGP Agent

The OVN BGP Agent allows to expose VMs/Containers through BGP on OVN
environments.

Initially, the agent will watch the OVN databases and react to events
such as VMs being created on provider network or VMs with attached FIPs
and advertises them via BGP.

In the future we would like to integrate the agent with other projects
such as the neutron-dynamic-routing [0] and re-use it's API.

The project is being proposed under x/ because it needs to mature prior
to requesting it to be included under the Neutron Stadium Projects
umbrella [1].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing
[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ieb92d6581247f0e6f4ab87807d0a6cdb18eb448d

commit_message:
[func test] create pps resource on OVS agent RP

To be able to test the nova logic with NET_KILOPACKET_PER_SEC
resource this patch changes the neutron simulation in the functional
test to include the reporting of this new resource to placement.

Change-Id: I823ff0e5d211ea083d9d8cdbceabcf87b15cbcc9
blueprint: qos-minimum-guaranteed-packet-rate

commit_message:
[func test] move port resource request tests

The functional.test_servers module is already huge. Before this patch
series starts adding more to it we move all the port resource request
related test cases to a new module.

Change-Id: I1aa55cfea23dc787c28baa86732907eb43cba2ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-26 08:17:02.000000000', 'message': 'Use assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

The assertItemsEqual method has been removed in Python 3.3 [1] but
it was kept alive by unittest2, imported by testtools. For better
compatibility, change to assertCountEqual.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue17866

Change-Id: I240355d5a0ebf8ece14bb2b4faf764c23477e322
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

The assertItemsEqual method has been removed in Python 3.3 [1] but
it was kept alive by unittest2, imported by testtools. For better
compatibility, change to assertCountEqual.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue17866

Change-Id: I240355d5a0ebf8ece14bb2b4faf764c23477e322

commit_message:
Update local_id limit to 255 characters

This avoids the "String length exceeded." error, when using LDAP
domain specific backend in case the user uses a user id
attribute, which can exceed the previous constraint of 64 chars.

Change-Id: I923a2a2a5e79c8f265ff436e96258288dddb867b
Closes-Bug: #1929066
Resolves: rhbz#1959345

commit_message:
Follow up for replacing assertItemsEqual

The assertItemsEqual has been replaced with assertCountEqual
since I7c20fec08e5dc9f67b34100c925ea6724bbd25f0 .
However the hacking check has not been enabled.

This patch enables the hacking check
and replace remaining assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual.

Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I86202f36f1b7c0bce8b29558ad1e377c336b7258
(cherry picked from commit 05ee23ea15d12259c14be0c43a07bf46ccff6f0b)

This likely will not break anything but we do not support runing nova in a multi threaded context via uwsgi so before we move forward with this we should discuss if that is something we actully want to support going forward as we know there are some eventlet related issues when greentreads are resumed on different os treads.'}, {'account_id': 27838, 'date': '2021-08-23 15:46:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> This likely will not break anything but we do not support runing nova in a multi threaded context via uwsgi so before we move forward with this we should discuss if that is something we actully want to support going forward as we know there are some eventlet related issues when greentreads are resumed on different os treads.

Get notification about this issue at product deployment, and tried to reproduce on devstack env. Probably i need to dig deeper and file a bug to discuss an issue. Issue is difficult to reproduce, but for now main hypothesis that batch instance delete handled by several threads(?) of the single Nova node leads to mysql error 2013 'Lost connection to MySQL server during query' bug. Very similar behavior was reproduced on testbench doing simultaneous mysql reads from several threads using non-scoped sqlalchemy session"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-08-23 16:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/804985/3/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 37m 10s'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-08-27 12:03:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> > This likely will not break anything but we do not support runing nova in a multi threaded context via uwsgi so before we move forward with this we should discuss if that is something we actully want to support going forward as we know there are some eventlet related issues when greentreads are resumed on different os treads.
> 
> Get notification about this issue at product deployment, and tried to reproduce on devstack env. Probably i need to dig deeper and file a bug to discuss an issue. Issue is difficult to reproduce, but for now main hypothesis that batch instance delete handled by several threads(?) of the single Nova node leads to mysql error 2013 'Lost connection to MySQL server during query' bug. Very similar behavior was reproduced on testbench doing simultaneous mysql reads from several threads using non-scoped sqlalchemy session

the nova compute agent process is singel theraded for the most part.

it has a option to run with a second thread for rpc heatbeats but that is all that thread does and it
use a seperate thread and proxy implemeaiton to comunicate with libvit but all of that is contole by a single main tread in which nova uses event let for coperative multi tasking.

we do not use multiple threads to execute any opertation in nova.

the compute agents also do not access the db directly they do that by rpc calls via the conductor.
the conductor is also single threaded in the same way using event let for coperative multi tasking using corotines.

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/doc/source/reference/threading.rst descibes novas threading model in more detail.

i think your best path forward would be to file a bug with the details fo the problem you are hitting and the version of openstack, os ectra that you have deployed so we can triage the bug report."}]

commit_message:
Fix for concurrent DB update issue

Currently, Nova relies on oslo_db managing connection to DB, sessions,
transaction handling, etc. Oslo_db uses SQLAlchemy as intermediate ORM
layer, which provides regular Session object to Nova context. But Nova
uses multi-thread architecture on top of uwsgi, which requires
thread-safe scoped_session. Modifying of oslo_db seems to be very
difficult because it strongly relies on current session mechanism. So,
this patch proposing lock usage which prevents multiple thread of the
same Nova node writing to DB simultaneously

Change-Id: Ia36b8e4eac507b826385d69f039eaca95ab617be

commit_message:
Remove the redundant index page for APIs entry

Now we just have using V2 API, and we have no plans to add other versions
of the API, the current API page entry is redundant [1], this patch will
remove it.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/accelerator/

Change-Id: Idd6aa49b3d63b4acbda2444d892e28158b011ad5

commit_message:
Add missing [oslo_reports] options

The oslo.reports library provides some options under the [oslo_reports]
section. This change ensures these parameters are rendered by
the oslo-config-generator command.

Closes-Bug: #1940733
Change-Id: I5e30ef458bccb0921ce77b2d9ef875bec72d0619

commit_message:
Fix wrong series in hirsute test bundle

Without this fix deployment fails with
ERROR cannot deploy bundle: cannot add unit for
application "masakari": acquiring machine to host
unit "masakari/0": cannot assign unit "masakari/0"
to machine 12: series does not match

Change-Id: Ib436e8916cb31fe049bc0a641fbd29fda2e0f260
(cherry picked from commit 737cea6409dbf9899e9ba985bbfa87232ddb3854)

commit_message:
Support monitoring Fluentd with Prometheus

This patch adds support for integrating Prometheus with Fluentd.
This can be used to extract useful information about the status
of Fluentd, such as output buffer capacity and logging rate,
and also to extract metrics from logs via custom Fluentd
configuration. More information can be found here in [1].

[1] https://docs.fluentd.org/monitoring-fluentd/monitoring-prometheus

Change-Id: I233d6dd744848ef1f1589a462dbf272ed0f3aaae

commit_message:
[CI] Test Swift upgrades

Swift is a major OpenStack project. It could use testing upgrades.

New jobs are placed in the experimental pipeline to avoid
excessive CI load on general changes.

Change-Id: I8a089fdd1f21eb4c3e00c38ea9dfcecc77565bf5
Related-Bug: #1874691

subject: Use Docker healthchecks for keystone-fernet container
messages:
[{'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-13 20:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-13 21:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-14 05:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-14 10:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:37:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-16 10:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-16 11:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-17 08:38:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Discuss: should container healthchecks depend on other containers functioning correctly?

I expect we have hidden deps elsewhere, e.g. API doesn't come up if DB is not accessible. The difference here though is that all keystone_ssh services must be accessible for the keystone_fernet healthcheck to work."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-17 08:50:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> Discuss: should container healthchecks depend on other containers functioning correctly?
> 
> I expect we have hidden deps elsewhere, e.g. API doesn't come up if DB is not accessible. The difference here though is that all keystone_ssh services must be accessible for the keystone_fernet healthcheck to work.


Ok, let's discuss - from my perspective of view i want to see if container or let's say his purpose or his job *is working*, it doesn't matter if it is dependent on some other container or not

Many services are dependent on rabbitmq, mysql, redis ..., but it doesn't mean i will not check his job, so i will check API 200 response .. 

In this case it's same, I want to check if key 0 is OK and if rotation is working.. Because keystone-fernet is service which is doing this..."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-17 08:51:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> > Patch Set 7:
> > 
> > Discuss: should container healthchecks depend on other containers functioning correctly?
> > 
> > I expect we have hidden deps elsewhere, e.g. API doesn't come up if DB is not accessible. The difference here though is that all keystone_ssh services must be accessible for the keystone_fernet healthcheck to work.
> 
> 
> Ok, let's discuss - from my perspective of view i want to see if container or let's say his purpose or his job *is working*, it doesn't matter if it is dependent on some other container or not
> 
> Many services are dependent on rabbitmq, mysql, redis ..., but it doesn't mean i will not check his job, so i will check API 200 response .. 
> 
> In this case it's same, I want to check if key 0 is OK and if rotation is working.. Because keystone-fernet is service which is doing this...

Ideally every container should has check, except containers which are doing nothing (kolla-toolbox for example)"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-17 09:12:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> > Patch Set 7:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 7:
> > > 
> > > Discuss: should container healthchecks depend on other containers functioning correctly?
> > > 
> > > I expect we have hidden deps elsewhere, e.g. API doesn't come up if DB is not accessible. The difference here though is that all keystone_ssh services must be accessible for the keystone_fernet healthcheck to work.
> > 
> > 
> > Ok, let's discuss - from my perspective of view i want to see if container or let's say his purpose or his job *is working*, it doesn't matter if it is dependent on some other container or not
> > 
> > Many services are dependent on rabbitmq, mysql, redis ..., but it doesn't mean i will not check his job, so i will check API 200 response .. 
> > 
> > In this case it's same, I want to check if key 0 is OK and if rotation is working.. Because keystone-fernet is service which is doing this...
> 
> Ideally every container should has check, except containers which are doing nothing (kolla-toolbox for example)

Now if I reboot controller1, controller2 and controller3 will start failing keystone_fernet healthchecks. Other services will not fail their healthchecks, since they typically are HA. If I'm alerting on failed healthchecks, then I might be surprised to see this one fire.

It's really just highlighting a deficiency in our fernet key rotation design, which requires all controllers to be up."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-17 09:23:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> > Patch Set 7:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 7:
> > > 
> > > > Patch Set 7:
> > > > 
> > > > Discuss: should container healthchecks depend on other containers functioning correctly?
> > > > 
> > > > I expect we have hidden deps elsewhere, e.g. API doesn't come up if DB is not accessible. The difference here though is that all keystone_ssh services must be accessible for the keystone_fernet healthcheck to work.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Ok, let's discuss - from my perspective of view i want to see if container or let's say his purpose or his job *is working*, it doesn't matter if it is dependent on some other container or not
> > > 
> > > Many services are dependent on rabbitmq, mysql, redis ..., but it doesn't mean i will not check his job, so i will check API 200 response .. 
> > > 
> > > In this case it's same, I want to check if key 0 is OK and if rotation is working.. Because keystone-fernet is service which is doing this...
> > 
> > Ideally every container should has check, except containers which are doing nothing (kolla-toolbox for example)
> 
> Now if I reboot controller1, controller2 and controller3 will start failing keystone_fernet healthchecks. Other services will not fail their healthchecks, since they typically are HA. If I'm alerting on failed healthchecks, then I might be surprised to see this one fire.
> 
> It's really just highlighting a deficiency in our fernet key rotation design, which requires all controllers to be up.

Yeah, from this perspective of view you are right ..
But, what if someone replaced ssh key on some controllers (and they are UP of course) ? Or someone manually changed configaration of ssh daemon ? Or there is some firewall blocking that port ? Or some ssh version mismatch ..

In that case I am happy that everything is working ..but it's not ..
So which approach is better ? To show operator fernet distributing is working ..or avoid that check because it *will* fail when restarting other controllers ?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-17 12:26:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

I agree with adding this healthcheck. I think it's worthwile to see if fernet token sync is (or can be) failing at this level."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-17 12:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-17 13:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-17 13:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

thanks'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-27 07:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Use Docker healthchecks for keystone-fernet container

This change enables the use of Docker healthchecks for
keystone-fernet container. It checks if "key 0" has
right permissions, and if rsync is able to distribute
keys to other keystones.

Implements: blueprint container-health-check
Change-Id: I17bea723d4109e869cd05d211f6f8e4653f46e17

commit_message:
Fix Masakari in multi-region deploys

to behave like it is most commonly expected - query Nova in the
same region.

Closes-Bug: #1939291

commit_message:
Use api-paste.ini from /etc/neutron

CentOS binary packages for Xena have moved Neutron's api-paste.ini file
to /etc/neutron [1]. Ubuntu packages already provide this file at this
location. Source images should also have api-paste.ini installed there.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/neutron-distgit/+/34845

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/804269

Change-Id: Ideb0247578afb8cc36bb6ac26d8ef7fda494bee3

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-08 05:11:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove instance flags when instance removed

Previously when an instance was removed the leadership settings and
charms.reactive flags remained for that instance's IP address. If a new
instance was subsequently added and happened to have the same IP address
the charm would never add the new instance to the cluster because it
believed the instance was already configured and clustered based on
leader settings.

Clear leader settings flags for instance cluster configured and
clustered.

Due to a bug in Juju the previous use of IP addresses with '.' were
unable to be unset. Transform dotted flags to use '-' instead.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/565

Change-Id: If3ffa9e9191c057ac7e3d96bfcf84d8a3a2ad45a
Closes-Bug: #1922394
Related-Bug: #1889792
(cherry picked from commit f22ca3b5b4dde7f92edb3a9b1e17835555590d1a)
"}, {'created': '2021-07-08 05:30:00.000000000', 'message': "Remove instance flags when instance removed

instance was subsequently added and happened to have the same IP address
the charm would never add the new instance to the cluster because it

leader settings.

Clear leader settings flags for instance cluster configured and
clustered.

Due to a bug in Juju the previous use of IP addresses with '.' were

Change-Id: If3ffa9e9191c057ac7e3d96bfcf84d8a3a2ad45a
Closes-Bug: #1922394

(cherry picked from commit f22ca3b5b4dde7f92edb3a9b1e17835555590d1a)
"}, {'created': '2021-08-26 13:19:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove instance flags when instance removed

Previously when an instance was removed the leadership settings and
charms.reactive flags remained for that instance's IP address. If a new
instance was subsequently added and happened to have the same IP address
the charm would never add the new instance to the cluster because it
believed the instance was already configured and clustered based on
leader settings.

Clear leader settings flags for instance cluster configured and
clustered.

Due to a bug in Juju the previous use of IP addresses with '.' were
unable to be unset. Transform dotted flags to use '-' instead.

Change-Id: If3ffa9e9191c057ac7e3d96bfcf84d8a3a2ad45a

commit_message:
Remove instance flags when instance removed

Previously when an instance was removed the leadership settings and
charms.reactive flags remained for that instance's IP address. If a new
instance was subsequently added and happened to have the same IP address
the charm would never add the new instance to the cluster because it
believed the instance was already configured and clustered based on
leader settings.

Clear leader settings flags for instance cluster configured and
clustered.

Due to a bug in Juju the previous use of IP addresses with '.' were
unable to be unset. Transform dotted flags to use '-' instead.

Change-Id: If3ffa9e9191c057ac7e3d96bfcf84d8a3a2ad45a
Closes-Bug: #1922394
Related-Bug: #1889792
(cherry picked from commit f22ca3b5b4dde7f92edb3a9b1e17835555590d1a)

subject: [CI] Slim down Masakari job
messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-07-29 10:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-30 10:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-27 07:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-29 10:38:02.000000000', 'message': '[CI] Slim down Masakari job

The Masakari job uses 4 nodes and defaulted to a quite bulky
and not really supported config (MariaDB and RMQ on 4 nodes).
This change slims it down so that we test only HA of Masakari
and hacluster. The other services are deployed single-node.

Additionally, simplify the network group (it does not affect any
other job, the logic was simply overdone there).

Change-Id: I74b315443f79d0d7780907fc785e1a29759c1803
(cherry picked from commit 7dfbcc71cb552ed32fa91a6a58bf456be58b259a)
'}]
commit_message:
[CI] Slim down Masakari job

The Masakari job uses 4 nodes and defaulted to a quite bulky
and not really supported config (MariaDB and RMQ on 4 nodes).
This change slims it down so that we test only HA of Masakari
and hacluster. The other services are deployed single-node.

Additionally, simplify the network group (it does not affect any
other job, the logic was simply overdone there).

Change-Id: I74b315443f79d0d7780907fc785e1a29759c1803
(cherry picked from commit 7dfbcc71cb552ed32fa91a6a58bf456be58b259a)

commit_message:
Check config when checking the containers

The proposed approach allows for checking whether config
files are current, e.g. cases when the deployment was aborted after
config files were generated but before they were injected into the
containers which lead to old config staying in containers.

After this patch we can do:
  kolla-ansible genconfig
  kolla-ansible deploy-containers
and it would do what we expected rather than being a noop
in the second part.

We also lose the need to have notifies
and whens in config and handler sections respectively.
This is optimised in a separate patch.

Future work:
- optimise for large files
  - could we get away with comparing timestamps and sizes?
    container's should have a newer timestamp due to copy,
    could also preserve it

Change-Id: I1d26e48e1958f13b854d8afded4bfba5021a2dec
Closes-Bug: #1848775
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/773257
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
(cherry picked from commit c3afbd3c5efb84a1df272bd44a46d4db60c69f0b)

subject: Add ability to retry image pulling
messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-23 13:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-24 09:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-27 07:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-23 13:27:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add ability to retry image pulling

Sometimes, the registries may intermittently fail to deliver the
images. This is often seen in the CI, though it also happens with
production deployments, even those with internal registries and/or
registry mirrors - due to sheer load when trying to pull the
images from many hosts.

This patchs adds two new vars to control retry behaviour.
The default has been set to make users happier by default. :-)

Change-Id: I81ad7d8642654f8474f11084c6934aab40243d35
(cherry picked from commit cbb567cb868b3681b82d325cfb712ef4601c91a9)
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to retry image pulling

Sometimes, the registries may intermittently fail to deliver the
images. This is often seen in the CI, though it also happens with
production deployments, even those with internal registries and/or
registry mirrors - due to sheer load when trying to pull the
images from many hosts.

This patchs adds two new vars to control retry behaviour.
The default has been set to make users happier by default. :-)

Change-Id: I81ad7d8642654f8474f11084c6934aab40243d35
(cherry picked from commit cbb567cb868b3681b82d325cfb712ef4601c91a9)

commit_message:
Add ability to retry image pulling

Sometimes, the registries may intermittently fail to deliver the
images. This is often seen in the CI, though it also happens with
production deployments, even those with internal registries and/or
registry mirrors - due to sheer load when trying to pull the
images from many hosts.

This patchs adds two new vars to control retry behaviour.
The default has been set to make users happier by default. :-)

Change-Id: I81ad7d8642654f8474f11084c6934aab40243d35
(cherry picked from commit cbb567cb868b3681b82d325cfb712ef4601c91a9)

subject: Add suppress_type_name to stop warnings with ES7
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nclean backport'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-27 07:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 08:22:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add suppress_type_name to stop warnings with ES7

When using elasticsearch 7 with fluentd, you seem to get a lot
of warnings in the docker logs output that look like:

    [types removal] Specifying types in bulk requests is deprecated.

The docs suggest adding suppress_type_name to stop these warnings,
and that seems to work without affecting any functionality.

Further info here:
https://github.com/uken/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch/issues/785

Closes-Bug: #1930856
Change-Id: I45be67df3717f78d78bcdc7df69600ab8681922f
'}]
commit_message:
Add suppress_type_name to stop warnings with ES7

When using elasticsearch 7 with fluentd, you seem to get a lot
of warnings in the docker logs output that look like:

    [types removal] Specifying types in bulk requests is deprecated.

The docs suggest adding suppress_type_name to stop these warnings,
and that seems to work without affecting any functionality.

Further info here:
https://github.com/uken/fluent-plugin-elasticsearch/issues/785

Closes-Bug: #1930856
Change-Id: I45be67df3717f78d78bcdc7df69600ab8681922f

(cherry picked from commit cbb567cb868b3681b82d325cfb712ef4601c91a9)

commit_message:
Add ability to retry image pulling

Sometimes, the registries may intermittently fail to deliver the
images. This is often seen in the CI, though it also happens with
production deployments, even those with internal registries and/or
registry mirrors - due to sheer load when trying to pull the
images from many hosts.

This patchs adds two new vars to control retry behaviour.
The default has been set to make users happier by default. :-)

Change-Id: I81ad7d8642654f8474f11084c6934aab40243d35
(cherry picked from commit cbb567cb868b3681b82d325cfb712ef4601c91a9)

commit_message:
Fix regression in image pull action v2

This time to fix roles other than common. :-)

Ussuri-only
Victoria+ not affected because Victoria dropped the reliance on
importing the common role via meta.

This regression was introduced by 16fe223bcf4e51cb0e1bb3bd05dde0121d621b1c
"Fix regression in image pull action"
so the previous attempt to fix the original regression.

That caused the kolla_role_name to leak everywhere.
This patch fixes this in fullest by wrapping the import in block.

Renamed "role" to "name" to unbreak ansible-lint.

Change-Id: Iadcbde2f3d127c1294b78798304bdfe707539ba1

commit_message:
Install Neutron BGPVPN in neutron-server

This is needed to be able to support EVPN scenarios and BGPVPN
support. This service plugin needs is only enabled via THT
But we need it to be installed in the neutron container in order
to add support for it.

Change-Id: I3a682168d66662c350cbc69885e1420d160f3369

> Hi Kafilat, tested in my environment. Doesn't work. Create doesn't accept is_default feature. More research needs to be done on this feature.

hi, Dina.
manila client and manila do not support is_default parameter when create share type.
if you want to set default share type, you should set default_share_type in manila.conf
and create a share type ,which name is same to the name in configure file."}, {'account_id': 32493, 'date': '2021-08-27 07:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-08-02 19:00:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Dina, 

Thank you for your patience with this change; it looks good; however, we recently introduced a possibility where manila does allow shares to be created from snapshots in a different AZ than the parent share: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/709697

I've added Douglas to confirm this; 

Unfortunately, you cannot predict whether the share creation itself will work if a different AZ is picked (it depends on whether the cloud operator has allowed creation requests to go through the scheduler) - so perhaps, we can just stick to defaulting to the original share's AZ, but, not disabling the input."}, {'account_id': 32531, 'date': '2021-08-08 18:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Goutham, thanks for reviewing. Ok, I will remove the part that disables the input.'}, {'account_id': 32531, 'date': '2021-08-19 21:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-08-19 23:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

it works fine in my test.
thanks for your change, Dina.'}]

commit_message:
Set parent share az when creating a share from snapshot

This patch-set modifies how we manage user input when creating a share
from snapshot. Since we use the same form for the basic create share workflow
and for the create share from snapshot workflow, we need to add a check
to distinguish both cases: when creating a share from snapshot, the
parent share availability zone is picked by default. Otherwise, if it's a
regular share create, the user can pick up the availability zone they need.

Closes-Bug: #1915706

Change-Id: I8d93c2214cb187a763df861555ddd7b444c9ca89

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints and requirements

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I4d7b11ac4ac5725ad0605b03ddabed22bad8d0d3

commit_message:
Add support for Jinja2 3.x filters

Jinja2 3.0 has deprecated the contextfunction() and contextfilter()
filters, and recommends to use pass_context() instead [1].

This commit adds support for pre-3.1 and 3.1 versions of Jinja2.

[1] - https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/3.0.x/api/#jinja2.contextfilter

Change-Id: Ic011f19ee0f96339ffff7b316b40663e840c0529
