I checked it out what if we drop the UNKNOWN row in the database...Any thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-03-18 18:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(3 comments)

Please see my comments inline about why I kept the default consumer type record UNKNOWN and let me know what you think. I am not sure how else to break the cycle of being able to create new records with a NULL consumer type ID. Or do you think it should be OK to have NULL forever?'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-03-18 18:38:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(6 comments)

mostly extra info about the choices here but the one thing you should definitely change is the inspector.from_engine() thing since that's deprecated."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-03-18 19:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2020-03-18 19:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> (1 comment)

lets talk about the two tables, "consumers" and "consumer_types".  the decision to make here is about the size of the data.

if existing "consumers" tables are huge, like 100ks of rows or more, then it becomes more risky to do a migration where there's a NOT NULL, or the other version where you start with NULL and then backfill then set NOT NULL, because yes, MySQL is not good at this kind of thing and then with Galera involved, that also causes things to work more poorly with very large transactions.  I'm not actually sure what the "message too long" error in https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1862205 is, I've not seen that before, it's not exactly what Galera does.   

but anyway, if consumers is huge, it's likely not worth the complexity to add a new NOT NULL column with a server default.


unfortunately, "consumers" being huge is also what would cause a LEFT OUTER JOIN between "consumers" and "consumer_types" to be slow.     So you might need to make sure you are mindful of what kinds of queries you do with these tables.  SQLAlchemy now has a very efficient form of eager loading called "selectin" loading that first and foremost has MySQL's awful SQL optimizer issues in mind, so if you want to load lots of consumers and their consumer_types eagerly loaded, the "selectin" load will emit a second quick SELECT statement for those types with the "consumers" SELECT unaffected.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-03-19 03:31:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Thanks Mike.

With all of this in mind, I think I'm back to thinking we should (1) not use a server_default so as to avoid a server backfill of default values on existing records and (2) do a batch placement-manage db online_data_migrations to allow population of the default value in chunks and then no longer create new records without a default value for older microversions <= 1.36.

That way we'll be able to guarantee that all records have consumer_type_id filled in by the V release, and then we can remove the migration code and change to a left outer join to an inner join."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-04-21 01:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-04-21 01:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

This update removes the DEFAULT_CONSUMER_TYPE_ID entirely and allows NULL in the Consumers.consumer_type_id column. Records with NULL consumer_type_id will be presented as 'unknown' users but kept as NULL internally.

This is done to avoid unnecessary data migrations."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-04-21 01:48:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> Patch Set 16:
> 
> This update removes the DEFAULT_CONSUMER_TYPE_ID entirely and allows NULL in the Consumers.consumer_type_id column. Records with NULL consumer_type_id will be presented as 'unknown' users but kept as NULL internally.
> 
> This is done to avoid unnecessary data migrations.

s/'unknown' users/'unknown' to users/"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-04-27 14:47:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I have two questions inline.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-04-27 15:51:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

OK, now as I read the next patch I understood this a bit better. I only have a small nit about a code comment and that can be fixed in a follow up so I upgrade my vote to +1. I still have question in the next patch hence I'm holding my +2 for now.
Cheers,
gibi"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-04-27 22:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

"}, {'created': '2019-09-02 09:35:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add consumer_types migration, database and object changes

In advance of a microversion 1.37, add the necessary database and object
code to support saving consumer types when creating consumers and
reporting those types when requesting usage information.

This patch adds a new table called ``consumer_types`` and also
add a new column called ``consumer_type_id`` that references the id
in the consumer_types table.

A consumer type object is added, similar to trait and resource class.
Like those there is a set of default data which needs to be ensured
at process startup time. In this case it is one row in the table:
ID 1 with value UNKNOWN. This is the default value for an
unspecified consumer type.

In future changes we may wish to AttributeCache consumer types in
the same way that traits and resource classes are cached.

Usage object can now be retrieved by consumer type and include
consumer type information when retrieved. Until 1.37 that info
will not be used in results.

Allocations are written and retrieved with a consumer type but
the data is not yet presented in HTTP requests.

Co-Authored-By: Surya Seetharaman <suryaseetharaman.9@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic74c3d1b8aa272e9c7d1070fe7658b928e693889
Story: 2005473
Task: 35683
Task: 36420

'}, {'created': '2019-09-03 09:43:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add consumer_types migration, database and object changes

In advance of a microversion 1.37, add the necessary database and object
code to support saving consumer types when creating consumers and
reporting those types when requesting usage information.

This patch adds a new table called ``consumer_types`` and also
add a new column called ``consumer_type_id`` that references the id
in the consumer_types table.

There is a set of default data which needs to be ensured at process
startup time. In production this is done via the database migration.
Because of the way the database-driven functional tests work the row
added in the migration is rolled back with each test, so it is manually
added back. The default data is one row in the table: ID 1 with value
UNKNOWN. This is the default value for an unspecified consumer type.

In future changes we may wish to AttributeCache consumer types in
the same way that traits and resource classes are cached.

Usage object can now be retrieved by consumer type and include
consumer type information when retrieved. Until 1.37 that info
will not be used in results.

Allocations are written and retrieved with a consumer type but
the data is not yet presented in HTTP requests.

The depends on is to a grenade change that upgrades placement
independent of nova. Neeed now because we need to do our own
db sync as a result of this new table.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/679655
Change-Id: Ic74c3d1b8aa272e9c7d1070fe7658b928e693889
Story: 2005473
Task: 35683
Task: 36420

commit_message:
Add consumer_types migration, database and object changes

In advance of a microversion 1.38, add the necessary database and
object code to support saving consumer types when creating consumers
and reporting those types when requesting usage information.

This patch adds a new table called ``consumer_types`` and also
add a new column called ``consumer_type_id`` that references the id
in the consumer_types table.

The consumer_type_id is nullable and records with a NULL
consumer_type_id are considered as 'unknown'.

In future changes we may wish to AttributeCache consumer types in
the same way that traits and resource classes are cached.

Usage object can now be retrieved by consumer type and include
consumer type information when retrieved. Until 1.38 that info
will not be used in results.

Allocations are written and retrieved with a consumer type but
the data is not yet presented in HTTP requests.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Story: 2005473
Task: 35683
Task: 36420

Change-Id: Ic74c3d1b8aa272e9c7d1070fe7658b928e693889

subject: Microversion 1.38: API support for consumer types

> Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1
> 
> thanks for adding the func test showing the race we discussed in the review. I just plug my -1 back until that race is fixed.

Apologies for the long delay. I spent a lot of time trying to figure out the root cause of why a single database transaction wasn't being used during the PUT /allocations for consumer. Originally, I thought I would handle the rollback higher up the stack but AFAICT it would have been at best really messy and confusing.

I think I finally found the cause for the multiple data transactions and by testing a fix with your DNM patch, it appears to solve the problem of the rollback.

Unfortunately I had to throw away my own functional test because it did not change its behavior after I added the fix (whereas your DNM test did). I think it's because of the mocking of database queries in my functional test. I couldn't think of a way to make a proper test, so I hope we can use the DNM test as verification that the rollback works."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-07-22 15:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

A TODO is left in placement/handlers/allocation.py where the database
is being accessed in a way that is not ideal. This will be cleared
up in a followup patch (to add use of an AttributeCache).

The depends on is to get nova functional tests passing them. Some of
them create allocations with 'placement latest'.

Story: 2005473
Task: 36421

Co-Authored-By: Surya Seetharaman <suryaseetharaman.9@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Microversion 1.38: API support for consumer types

Update allocations, reshaper and usage APIs to accept and present
consumer_type in microversion 1.38.

ensure_consumer in placement/handlers/util.py is updated to be consumer
type aware.

allocation, usage and reshaper schema and handlers are updated

gabbits/consumer-types-1.38.yaml adds tests across the various URIs

A TODO is left in placement/handlers/allocation.py where the database
is being accessed in a way that is not ideal. This will be cleared
up in a followup patch (to add use of an AttributeCache).

Co-Authored-By: Surya Seetharaman <suryaseetharaman.9@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Story: 2005473
Task: 36421

Change-Id: I24c2315093e07dbf25c4fb53152e6a4de7477a51

during ha states transitions and e.g. to understand failures like

commit_message:
[L3HA] Add extra logs to the process of ha state changes

Some extra debug logs may be useful to understand exactly what happens
during ha states transitions and e.g. to understand failures like
described in the related bug.

Related-bug: #1939507
Change-Id: Id708b2c7a602df8d4ba1b32e58d4b152b5c58ba6

cert-rotation: Correct and enhance the rotation script.

Corrected the counter increment and enhanced the script to handle
situation if the certificate is stuck in issuing state.

Move pre overcloud upgrade task

 Move pre overcloud upgrade task just before upgrade prepare, to make sure everything is set up before applying workarounds.

Change-Id: I6c24d522d79edd98be3e18a9e539ff05cccce118

commit_message:
Move build_extra_template before upgrade prepare

build_extra_template.yaml specifies config_heat_extra_yaml fact which is
used in overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.j2. This patch moves it before
upgrade prepare to render upgrade prepare script properly.

Change-Id: I4b6d2d7345c9ad8f84a26909eb7ad350fe4e35a5
(cherry picked from commit 0ee1f0dcf05581b3a43d539a0625a4f2b8f50c36)

commit_message:
host monitor by consul

This spec introduces a new host monitor by consul. It monitors host
heartbeat via management, tenant and storage connectivity. Only in the
case of defined HA strategy, it will trigger host recovery, for example,
storage interface disconnected.

Change-Id: If81a6a9543513acf199afe6a17dceb1544657272
Implements: bp host-monitor-by-consul

commit_message:
Remove redundant/legacy is_admin logic

The original model used was to assert is_admin on the object context
which was actually used in only one place in ironic's code. Redudnantly
of course.

This is an excess call of is_admin on all API invocations, and is
simply not necessary as individual calls have API policy checking
and is_admin was only being consulted in the glance service utils...
However, the glance service utils also confirmed it should be able
to access glance if there was an auth_token present on the request
which should also always be the case. This was somewhat identified
as redundant/possible bug during the Wallaby cycle and appears to
be fine to remove

This does *not* remove the deprecated rule. At present, it appears
that rule may not be removed until after Xena.

Change-Id: I5a176f51db93d2a2238496f6955c1c7d9a79c548
(cherry picked from commit f91915d4cd2abec54d760556e0e5c5f7ddae70ca)

'}, {'created': '2020-07-09 14:51:34.000000000', 'message': 'Performance: Split out prometheus node exporter and cadvisor

Executing tasks has a performance penalty, even if they are skipped [1].
The prometheus role deploys a few types of services:

* core prometheus server and alert manager services
* centralised service-based exporters (mysql, memcached, OpenStack,
  etc.)
* distributed exporters (node exporter, cadvisor) that are deployed to
  all hosts

There is a significant overhead in executing the tasks associated with
the core services and centralised exporters against all hosts, even
though they are skipped.

This change extracts the node exporter and cadvisor deployment into a
new prometheus-all role, to avoid executing the prometheus role against
all hosts. The new role is lightweight, and has a small number of tasks,
which should significantly improve performance.

[1]

commit_message:
Performance: Split out prometheus node exporter and cadvisor

Executing tasks has a performance penalty, even if they are skipped [1].
The prometheus role deploys a few types of services:

* core prometheus server and alert manager services
* centralised service-based exporters (mysql, memcached, OpenStack,
  etc.)
* distributed node-based exporters (node exporter, cadvisor) that are
  deployed to all hosts

There is a significant overhead in executing the tasks associated with
the core services and centralised exporters against all hosts, even
though they are skipped.

This change extracts the node exporter and cadvisor deployment into a
new prometheus-node-exporters role, to avoid executing the prometheus
role against all hosts. The new role is lightweight, and has a small
number of tasks, which should significantly improve performance.

[1]
https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-scaling/blob/master/doc/skip.md

Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements

Change-Id: I6913756ff85b7cc626d50ce16d55085d3683db17

commit_message:
bump py35,py37 to py3 in tox.ini

In 'victoria' cycle, we should test py38 by default.
But we let local development tests run with whatever the default
local py3 is the default.

ref:
  https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html

Change-Id: Iaf309da4683fe69b2bb7d1691e0fe498920d7db2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-06 11:18:20.000000000', 'message': "Debian/Ubuntu: install APT keys like APT expects them

apt-key is deprecated already and in Debian 'bullseye' it even complain
when we use it the way we did.

Proper way is to store key files in /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/ directory.
And this is what this patch does.

There is one list of APT files for both distributions.

Change-Id: Ie19bf46236907d79cb42a5e94cd1067e952b8cbb

commit_message:
Debian/Ubuntu: handle APT keys in proper way

apt-key is deprecated and in Debian 'bullseye' it complain when we use
it the way we did.

The right way is to store key files in separate directory and then, for
each repo source file, point to proper key. And this is what this patch
does.

Both distros use the same keys now.

More info: https://michael-prokop.at/blog/2021/02/16/how-to-properly-use-3rd-party-debian-repository-signing-keys-with-apt/

Change-Id: Ie19bf46236907d79cb42a5e94cd1067e952b8cbb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-24 22:43:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Ceph checkDNS script

The checkDNS script which is run inside the ceph-mon pods has had
a bug for a while now. If a value of "up" is passed in, it adds
brackets around it, but then doesn't check for the brackets when
checking for a value of "up". This causes a value of "{up}" to be
written into the ceph.conf for the mon_host line and that causes
the mon_host to not be able to respond to ceph/rbd commands. Its
normally not a problem if DNS is working, but if DNS stops working
this can happen.

This patch changes the comparison to look for "{up}" instead of
"up", which should fix the problem.

Change-Id: I89cf07b28ad8e0e529646977a0a36dd2df48966d
'}, {'created': '2021-08-24 22:44:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Ceph checkDNS script

The checkDNS script which is run inside the ceph-mon pods has had
a bug for a while now. If a value of "up" is passed in, it adds
brackets around it, but then doesn't check for the brackets when
checking for a value of "up". This causes a value of "{up}" to be

this can happen.

commit_message:
Fix Ceph checkDNS script

The checkDNS script which is run inside the ceph-mon pods has had
a bug for a while now. If a value of "up" is passed in, it adds
brackets around it, but then doesn't check for the brackets when
checking for a value of "up". This causes a value of "{up}" to be
written into the ceph.conf for the mon_host line and that causes
the mon_host to not be able to respond to ceph/rbd commands. Its
normally not a problem if DNS is working, but if DNS stops working
this can happen.

This patch changes the comparison to look for "{up}" instead of
"up" in three different files, which should fix the problem.

Change-Id: I89cf07b28ad8e0e529646977a0a36dd2df48966d

commit_message:
Convert all OS module imports to collections imports

Instead of importing code from 2.9 Ansible modules, start import
it from Openstack Ansible collection.
It requires Openstack Ansible collection to be installed and will
work with both Ansible 2.9 and 2.11

Change-Id: I0f9f0d26a6b499c13af994edd1353b19620be14d
(cherry picked from commit a4afb20deb9d0b95f0cc01bb893eb537fac56f16)

commit_message:
Add DeployedCeph boolean parameter

If the Ceph cluster has already been deployed but needs to be
configured so that the overcloud can use it (create cephx keys,
pools, configure RGW with haproxy, etc), then this parameter
should be set to true. Set this parameter to false to have
cephadm deploy the ceph cluster during overcloud deployment.
DeployedCeph and CephDynamicSpec are mutually exclusive.

Depends-On: Id32f1135c857eb4ccc4a6c7356957ff0f5182839
Change-Id: Ic80f5d6fd0956040b9ced1e9e0f6079a2c0d3049
(cherry picked from commit feb93b26b42673d1958917603f2498b9456fb34c)

commit_message:
Move build_extra_template before upgrade prepare

build_extra_template.yaml specifies config_heat_extra_yaml fact which is
used in overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.j2. This patch moves it before
upgrade prepare to render upgrade prepare script properly.

Change-Id: I4b6d2d7345c9ad8f84a26909eb7ad350fe4e35a5

Also ran multiple c8s jobs with test patch https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144 and all were green'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-08-10 05:10:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Note we've talked about this before [1] and that links to [2].  I certainly appreciate your efforts in trying to track down these random failures.  Do we have a sense of *why* centos needs x2 RAM?

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/761119
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-11-03.log.html#t2020-11-03T15:18:01"}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-08-10 05:35:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Note we've talked about this before [1] and that links to [2].  I certainly appreciate your efforts in trying to track down these random failures.  Do we have a sense of *why* centos needs x2 RAM?
> 
> [1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/761119
> [2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-11-03.log.html#t2020-11-03T15:18:01

Thanks @Ian for sharing the links, No x2 atleast not needed, i just did it to get to the original 8GB, in my tests in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144 i can see green runs even with 4GB, will give a try even to 2GB/3GB too see if that also enough and update the patch, from above discussion i see can do swap updates to minimal required at job level, although it should be avoided wherever possible.
No i didn't checked why it's happening in CentOS jobs only, i just checked failures in my patches and tried to track it down and most failures were in centos8, only seen 1 ubuntu job which failed at resources, added details of that in bug, so seems it's more general issue, affecting centos more."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-08-11 17:22:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > Note we've talked about this before [1] and that links to [2].  I certainly appreciate your efforts in trying to track down these random failures.  Do we have a sense of *why* centos needs x2 RAM?
> > 
> > [1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/761119
> > [2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-11-03.log.html#t2020-11-03T15:18:01
> 
> Thanks @Ian for sharing the links, No x2 atleast not needed, i just did it to get to the original 8GB, in my tests in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144 i can see green runs even with 4GB, will give a try even to 2GB/3GB too see if that also enough and update the patch, from above discussion i see can do swap updates to minimal required at job level, although it should be avoided wherever possible.
> No i didn't checked why it's happening in CentOS jobs only, i just checked failures in my patches and tried to track it down and most failures were in centos8, only seen 1 ubuntu job which failed at resources, added details of that in bug, so seems it's more general issue, affecting centos more.

Ok i digged further, and tracked down to qemu-kvm processes taking much memory(guest memory + qemu process overhead) in CentOS jobs leading to hit memory crunch. And to have same applied into ubuntu forced similar qemu version there and can see similar memory crunch in ubuntu, although that had different errors but hit memory crunch, all tests done in test patch https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144.

Also tried 2GB, 3GB, with 3 GB it's much better but seen a few failure with it too, so i think 4 GB should be sufficient for these jobs to be green back. Also checked ksm and while looking at it came across following NOTE in https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/7/html/virtualization_tuning_and_optimization_guide/chap-ksm, but with qemu-4 not seeing this issue so seems it's specific to qemu-5.

Ensure the swap size is sufficient for the committed RAM even without taking KSM into account. KSM reduces the RAM usage of identical or similar guests. Overcommitting guests with KSM without sufficient swap space may be possible, but is not recommended because guest virtual machine memory use can result in pages becoming unshared.  

Also will update the patch to use 4GB itself instead of 8GB, any opinions on it or something else to check ?"}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-08-12 16:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-08-23 07:12:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > No i didn't checked why it's happening in CentOS jobs only, i just checked failures in my patches and tried to track it down and most failures were in centos8, only seen 1 ubuntu job which failed at resources, added details of that in bug, so seems it's more general issue, affecting centos more.
> 
> Ok i digged further, and tracked down to qemu-kvm processes taking much memory(guest memory + qemu process overhead) in CentOS jobs leading to hit memory crunch. And to have same applied into ubuntu forced similar qemu version there and can see similar memory crunch in ubuntu, although that had different errors but hit memory crunch, all tests done in test patch https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144.
> 
> Also tried 2GB, 3GB, with 3 GB it's much better but seen a few failure with it too, so i think 4 GB should be sufficient for these jobs to be green back. Also checked ksm and while looking at it came across following NOTE in https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/7/html/virtualization_tuning_and_optimization_guide/chap-ksm, but with qemu-4 not seeing this issue so seems it's specific to qemu-5.

So it's specifically due to https://github.com/qemu/qemu/commit/600e17b261555c56a048781b8dd5ba3985650013 included in qemu-5, i tested it by using tb-size 32 MB(patching libvirt) in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144 and job got green with 1 GB.
> 
> Ensure the swap size is sufficient for the committed RAM even without taking KSM into account. KSM reduces the RAM usage of identical or similar guests. Overcommitting guests with KSM without sufficient swap space may be possible, but is not recommended because guest virtual machine memory use can result in pages becoming unshared.  
> 
> Also will update the patch to use 4GB itself instead of 8GB, any opinions on it or something else to check ?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-23 07:23:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Also checked ksm and while looking at it came across following NOTE in https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/7/html/virtualization_tuning_and_optimization_guide/chap-ksm, but with qemu-4 not seeing this issue so seems it's specific to qemu-5.
> 
> So it's specifically due to https://github.com/qemu/qemu/commit/600e17b261555c56a048781b8dd5ba3985650013 included in qemu-5, i tested it by using tb-size 32 MB(patching libvirt) in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144 and job got green with 1 GB.
> > 
> > Ensure the swap size is sufficient for the committed RAM even without taking KSM into account. KSM reduces the RAM usage of identical or similar guests. Overcommitting guests with KSM without sufficient swap space may be possible, but is not recommended because guest virtual machine memory use can result in pages becoming unshared.  
> > 
> > Also will update the patch to use 4GB itself instead of 8GB, any opinions on it or something else to check ?

I would prefer to get this patched in libvirt."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-08-23 07:32:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 1:
> > > 
> > > > Patch Set 1:
> > > > 
> > > > > Patch Set 1:
> > > > > 
> > > > > Note we've talked about this before [1] and that links to [2].  I certainly appreciate your efforts in trying to track down these random failures.  Do we have a sense of *why* centos needs x2 RAM?
> > > > > 
> > > > > [1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/761119
> > > > > [2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2020-11-03.log.html#t2020-11-03T15:18:01
> > > > 
> > > > Thanks @Ian for sharing the links, No x2 atleast not needed, i just did it to get to the original 8GB, in my tests in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144 i can see green runs even with 4GB, will give a try even to 2GB/3GB too see if that also enough and update the patch, from above discussion i see can do swap updates to minimal required at job level, although it should be avoided wherever possible.
> > > > No i didn't checked why it's happening in CentOS jobs only, i just checked failures in my patches and tried to track it down and most failures were in centos8, only seen 1 ubuntu job which failed at resources, added details of that in bug, so seems it's more general issue, affecting centos more.
> > > 
> > > Ok i digged further, and tracked down to qemu-kvm processes taking much memory(guest memory + qemu process overhead) in CentOS jobs leading to hit memory crunch. And to have same applied into ubuntu forced similar qemu version there and can see similar memory crunch in ubuntu, although that had different errors but hit memory crunch, all tests done in test patch https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144.
> > > 
> > > Also tried 2GB, 3GB, with 3 GB it's much better but seen a few failure with it too, so i think 4 GB should be sufficient for these jobs to be green back. Also checked ksm and while looking at it came across following NOTE in https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/7/html/virtualization_tuning_and_optimization_guide/chap-ksm, but with qemu-4 not seeing this issue so seems it's specific to qemu-5.
> > 
> > So it's specifically due to https://github.com/qemu/qemu/commit/600e17b261555c56a048781b8dd5ba3985650013 included in qemu-5, i tested it by using tb-size 32 MB(patching libvirt) in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144 and job got green with 1 GB.
> > > 
> > > Ensure the swap size is sufficient for the committed RAM even without taking KSM into account. KSM reduces the RAM usage of identical or similar guests. Overcommitting guests with KSM without sufficient swap space may be possible, but is not recommended because guest virtual machine memory use can result in pages becoming unshared.  
> > > 
> > > Also will update the patch to use 4GB itself instead of 8GB, any opinions on it or something else to check ?
> 
> I would prefer to get this patched in libvirt.

Considering the commit message i doubt it will get into libvirt, but if it get's there we can revert this patch."}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-08-23 10:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-08-24 05:46:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Set swap size to 4G for c8 jobs

Tempest is failing randomly with different reasons
as mentioned in the bug, updating swap size those
issues are not seen.

Before [1] default swap size used to be 8GB but was dropped
to 1G so need to configure it in required job itself.

Did couple of tests in [2] and with 4GB+ swap jobs are
running green. On investigation found that with qemu-5
both Ubuntu and CentOS jobs have memory crunch, currently
Ubuntu jobs are not impacted as they are running with
qemu-4.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/750941
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/803144

Closes-Bug: #1938914
Change-Id: I57910b5fde5ddf2bd37d93e06c1aff77c6e231e9

commit_message:
Checking IP version from extra-dhcp-options

Existing IPv4 and IPv6 extra-dhcp-options tests ignored the ip_version
attribute, so all the extra-dhcp-options tested had IP version 4

Change-Id: I5fee2579a158918c2c22d95493b471e23d0f8161

I think I found the issue with the CA certificates. Because we're using self-signed certs, when you have multiple with the trust store, if they all have the same organisation name then it seems to only pull out one, and in some cases it will be the wrong one.

See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728607/2 for what seemed to work locally as a workaround: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728607/

commit_message:
Allow watch_frr options to be set and support frr-8.0

frr-8.0 does not need any watchfrr options set.
Let's still allow some customizability in case we'll need to
tweak them one day.

Tested on a BGP deployment.

Change-Id: I5943d7b00634c3d733e3e38b4ed247ccac253e27
(cherry picked from commit f13b51fa0e0d690020287601b46bd2e6198c2982)

commit_message:
Remove all hieradata overriding for undercloud memcache

Now puppet-tripleo is responsible to set memcache for caching, we can
remove uselsess hieradata overriding in the undercloud environment
file.

Conflicts:
	environments/undercloud.yaml
	sample-env-generator/undercloud-minion.yaml

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/805324
Change-Id: I20ebe407a362e939fbda7a511de287cbe46a0ef9
(cherry picked from commit cec4048d15c1368602b66068e69d4d1dc9bfdb2e)

subject: Config: Set default home to /var/lib/{user}
messages:
[{'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-07-28 11:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-07-28 11:18:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-07-29 09:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-07-29 10:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2021-07-30 10:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-07-30 11:47:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I wonder if it's the best default here; how much does it change the current situation?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-07-30 11:48:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

some more discussion in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/802671
perhaps this is not needed'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-05 12:11:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> some more discussion in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/802671
> perhaps this is not needed

I've replied in review 802671 - I don't insist on home dir change, I just think it's better to point to /var/lib/{service}:

1. Because most deb packages are creating homes in this way (especially binary images where openstack components are installed from deb packages also)
2. Source images using /var/lib/{service} as home directory also.

So this is only cosmetic but right approach.
Of course, fix is most important ..so if you think it is totally useless and not right way .. I will abandon and rebase this chain."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-05 12:22:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3:
> > 
> > some more discussion in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/802671
> > perhaps this is not needed
> 
> I've replied in review 802671 - I don't insist on home dir change, I just think it's better to point to /var/lib/{service}:
> 
> 1. Because most deb packages are creating homes in this way (especially binary images where openstack components are installed from deb packages also)
> 2. Source images using /var/lib/{service} as home directory also.
> 
> So this is only cosmetic but right approach.
> Of course, fix is most important ..so if you think it is totally useless and not right way .. I will abandon and rebase this chain.

I mean: the default to /var/lib/<service> is fine - this is likely the default anyway when creating a system user, we can be explicit. I wonder if we ever need to customise this home directory. I think not."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-05 12:28:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 3:
> > > 
> > > some more discussion in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/802671
> > > perhaps this is not needed
> > 
> > I've replied in review 802671 - I don't insist on home dir change, I just think it's better to point to /var/lib/{service}:
> > 
> > 1. Because most deb packages are creating homes in this way (especially binary images where openstack components are installed from deb packages also)
> > 2. Source images using /var/lib/{service} as home directory also.
> > 
> > So this is only cosmetic but right approach.
> > Of course, fix is most important ..so if you think it is totally useless and not right way .. I will abandon and rebase this chain.
> 
> I mean: the default to /var/lib/<service> is fine - this is likely the default anyway when creating a system user, we can be explicit. I wonder if we ever need to customise this home directory. I think not.

Oh, now I got it - well, I've implemented this because hrw noticed that tcpdump (which is installed from package) has originally set home directory to /nonexistent ... but yeah ..i can drop this feature - Just tell me guys .. i will do what do you think is better .. I just would like to fix/merge a bug :)"}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-05 12:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-05 13:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

This is now overly complicated without the flexibility - I meant to hardcode the home path similarly to the shell (just using name here).'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-05 14:00:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
>

commit_message:
Config: Set default home to /var/lib/{user}

This patch is setting users home dirs to /var/lib/{user}.
This is the usual default but it's good to be explicit.

Change-Id: Idda2ff4a5fea56e4e17a9dbf05141572671b6afc

subject: Fix error in octavia inventory when skipping controllers update
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-25 12:31:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error in octavia inventory when skipping controllers update

When controllers are added to the DeploymentServerBlacklist, the \"Write
octavia inventory\" task failed on an undefined variable in the
ansible_facts. Add a condition in the jinja template that checks if the
facts of the targeted host have been gathered.

Change-Id: I80184fb1bc1c6d3b98eba25f33026cc70a9d84bc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error in octavia inventory when skipping controllers update

When controllers are added to the DeploymentServerBlacklist, the \"Write
octavia inventory\" task failed on an undefined variable in the
ansible_facts. Add a condition in the jinja template that checks if the
facts of the targeted host have been gathered.

Change-Id: I80184fb1bc1c6d3b98eba25f33026cc70a9d84bc

commit_message:
Silence debug logging from oslo_policy

While it's not entirely useless, it's extremely verbose and account
for 2/3 of ironic-api logs even when keystone is disabled.

Change-Id: I991d2af7eb6987830a5fa449026f43ac7a09fcff

Glance has changed the format of the cinder URIs in image locations
so that they can look like
   cinder://glance-store-name/volume_id
in addition to the legacy format
   cinder://volume_id

Change the cinder code so that it can handle both formats for

Closes-bug: #1898075
(cherry picked from commit 4a5ff4eb7577867bc1a6b89718ecd66888430d84)
'}]
commit_message:
Support Images API v2.11

Glance has changed the format of the cinder URIs in image locations
so that they can look like
   cinder://glance-store-name/volume_id
in addition to the legacy format
   cinder://volume_id

Change the cinder code so that it can handle both formats for
reading.  (We only need to write the legacy format.)

Change-Id: I8c176bf4c875061591bb6c94654a2cef643a4dcb
Closes-bug: #1898075
(cherry picked from commit 4a5ff4eb7577867bc1a6b89718ecd66888430d84)

commit_message:
[winstackers] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I9c73b1be96d3dafe2e3e76c2f55c76707f0cfa45

'}, {'created': '2021-08-25 12:24:05.000000000', 'message': 'Bump os-traits to latest 2.6.0

The latest os-traits release introduced 3 new standard traits

While bumping the os-traits requirements it turned out that the
lower-constraints become extra slow causing a timeout. This result is a
catch-22 situation. The lower-constraint job cannot be fixed alone as
the global requirement bump already happened for os-traits 2.6.0

Pip is slow to resolve version constraints with many unrestricted
dependencies. The recent slowness seems to be due to amqp is being
unrestricted and pip starts with amqp 5.0.3 but the real minimum is
somewhere around amqp 2.5.0. This patch adds amqp 2.5.0 to

commit_message:
Bump os-traits to latest 2.6.0

The latest os-traits release introduced 3 new standard traits

While bumping the os-traits requirements it turned out that the
lower-constraints become extra slow causing a timeout. This result is a
catch-22 situation. The lower-constraint job cannot be fixed alone as
the global requirement bump already happened for os-traits 2.6.0
requiring fixing the placement tests. But fixing the placement tests
alone is not possible as the lower-constraints job will time out.

So this patch squashes in Icd0a304fc989c9535db125cd483ecac92deb011d:

Pip is slow to resolve version constraints with many unrestricted
dependencies. The recent slowness seems to be due to amqp is being
unrestricted and pip starts with amqp 5.0.3 but the real minimum is
somewhere around amqp 2.5.0. This patch adds amqp 2.5.0 to
lower-constraints to speed up the pip version resolution.

Change-Id: I89b330d0647b0883eecaf40b988a1a4779bcb1dd

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Fix for create snapshot

Payload response change from REST means that the
Device Label no longer exists in the format expected and
causes an IndexError exception. This is the case in PowerMaxOS
5978.711 and later.

Closes-Bug: #1939139

Change-Id: If465bc719cea2d4e85b37527f3f7ac916b5de638
(cherry picked from commit 672a0e97988755012ff87fb85bddc1cd125f1898)
(cherry picked from commit a366ed53b1ea17d0be266a4fca56785410b376cf)
(cherry picked from commit 37be715cc7fd20878bbcd77965d2b9a902a25a99)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo
  * Some other sections are obsolete
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use sphinx-build everywhere

Change-Id: I42a8071625d8e309d1580f31e440df4d54d2d37b

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Switch to Python3
- Switch to openstackdocstheme
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Change jobs to build documentation

Change-Id: I4d31607a4a7079f39b6afa2cddb2804612844f18

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-31 17:44:48.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4b6d35a0e20e0991091ff3d71d4d7186071d4c2f
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4b6d35a0e20e0991091ff3d71d4d7186071d4c2f

commit_message:
Fix requirements

Install neutron via requirements to unblock jobs.

Zuul will install neutron from source due to use neutron jobs.

We have to remove neutron/test-requirements since those duplicate what
networking-powervm has. If anything is missing, we better sync manually.

Update doc/requirements.txt to pass requirements-check job.

Use neutron lower-constraints job so that master of neutron is used.

Change-Id: I20c6b67872f5bf6d75d236a6b998e4cc1998d6a4

commit_message:
Don't use branch matching

This is not needed since we have implicit branch matches - and even
hurts since the master version is used on stable branches

Remove here - this ensures that future stable branches and master are
fine.

Change-Id: I24a46d0d7476203feccb1250d4ce3ad94b2e0ecd
(cherry picked from commit be537bb79c4f1f999c33d396dcba4adbae2be599)

commit_message:
Don't use branch matching

This is not needed since we have implicit branch matches - and even
hurts since the master version is used on stable branches

Remove here - this ensures that future stable branches and master are
fine.

Change-Id: I24a46d0d7476203feccb1250d4ce3ad94b2e0ecd
(cherry picked from commit be537bb79c4f1f999c33d396dcba4adbae2be599)

I'm currently trying a few builds of different libvirt versions with this python-libvirt, to see which one introduced the problem."}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-11-07 12:30:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

e832cfd7248ba453300abcc6a0eca555ed478008 that last changed libvirt-python to 5.1.0 is from Tue Mar 5 06:14:31 2019 +0000 .


Leap 15.2 shipped with a version of libvirt https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/openSUSE:Leap:15.2/libvirt that was last changed 2020-06-10 14:49 UTC. It was updated twice https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/openSUSE:Leap:15.2:Update/libvirt.13730 on 2020-09-19 12:20 UTC and https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/openSUSE:Leap:15.2:Update/libvirt.14632 on 2020-10-30 17:23 UTC.


I tested building the package of python-libvirt 5.1.0 available in Leap 15.1 with all 3 versions of libvirt mentioned above. All failed in the same way as this log:


  /usr/bin/python generator.py libvirt /usr/share/libvirt/api/libvirt-api.xml
    Found 466 functions in /usr/share/libvirt/api/libvirt-api.xml
    Found 0 functions in libvirt-override-api.xml
    Generated 370 wrapper functions
    Missing type converters:
    virTypedParameterPtr *:1
    virNetworkPortPtr **:1
    virTypedParameterPtr:1
    virNetworkPortPtr:12
    ERROR: failed virConnectSetIdentity
    ERROR: failed virDomainGetGuestInfo
    ERROR: failed virNetworkListAllPorts
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortCreateXML
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortDelete
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortFree
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortGetNetwork
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortGetParameters
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortGetUUID
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortGetUUIDString
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortGetXMLDesc
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortLookupByUUID
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortLookupByUUIDString
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortRef
    ERROR: failed virNetworkPortSetParameters


That should have covered the version that was working before, but seems not. What made it work before?'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-11-07 12:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

We did update from Leap 15.1 to 15.2 in the mean while so libvirt was changed from 5.1.0 to 6.0.0, that creates this problem.'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-11-07 12:43:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Do we need to keep Leap 15.1 for stein, as we don't want to change libvirt-python to 6.0.0 in requirements for stein?"}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-11-10 19:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/762204/ for fixing the libvirt issue.'}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-11-10 20:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-11-10 20:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

I don't think the requirements update is reasonable because it doesn't match what Bionic is using for stein. Bumping versions for a running deployment isn't something we can enforce onto our users IMO, so the consequence would be that we have to stop testing this branch with opensuse."}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-11-11 11:51:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

It doesn't require an upgrade of a running deployment. It only allows a higher maximum version, it doesn't touch the minimum."}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2020-11-11 19:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-11-11 19:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

This can still be merged, to make use of stein on Leap 15.1 without CI.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-11-14 18:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2021-08-25 15:01:29.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

'}, {'created': '2020-07-02 08:18:58.000000000', 'message': 'Handle uwsgi install for openSUSE

Add packages for openSUSE distribution for installation of uwsgi.

For stein add in addition:
Adapt PYTHON_PATH and add /usr/local/bin to PATH. It is not in PATH on
openSUSE. This is needed to fix the setup after the pip/virtualenv
changes. Persist PATH in /etc/environment .
Also install python2 version of uwsgi module in addtion to 3.

Co-Authored-By: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>
Co-Authored-By: Jan Zerebecki <jzerebecki@suse.com>
Change-Id: I2ce8959460a79b6472bd9dd59edd7d94eccbacf5
(cherry-picked from commit 10c3ffd26557f1921841e456b003a77f6fb11948)
'}, {'created': '2020-07-07 14:44:00.000000000', 'message': "Handle uwsgi install for openSUSE

Add packages for openSUSE distribution for installation of uwsgi.

For stein add in addition:
Adapt PYTHON_PATH and add /usr/local/bin to PATH. It is not in PATH
because we don't pick up /etc/profile where it is usually added. This is
needed to fix the setup after the pip/virtualenv changes.
Also install python2 version of uwsgi module in addtion to 3.

The depended on patch is to set PATH for temptest for the same reason.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739778/
Co-Authored-By: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>

because we don't pick up /etc/profile where it is usually added. This is
needed to fix the setup after the pip/virtualenv changes.
Also install python2 version of uwsgi module in addtion to 3.

The depended on patch is to set PATH for temptest for the same reason.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739778/

commit_message:
Handle uwsgi install for openSUSE

Add packages for openSUSE distribution for installation of uwsgi.

For stein add in addition:
Adapt PYTHON_PATH and add /usr/local/bin to PATH. It is not in PATH
because we don't pick up /etc/profile where it is usually added. This is
needed to fix the setup after the pip/virtualenv changes.
Also install python2 version of uwsgi module in addtion to 3.

The depended on patch is to set PATH for temptest for the same reason.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739778/
Co-Authored-By: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>
Co-Authored-By: Jan Zerebecki <jzerebecki@suse.com>
Change-Id: I2ce8959460a79b6472bd9dd59edd7d94eccbacf5
(cherry-picked from commit 10c3ffd26557f1921841e456b003a77f6fb11948)

commit_message:
Add FloatingIpMultipleRoutersTest to skiplist

As described in bug #1940568, the test is frequently failing so
we are moving it to skiplist to unblock jobs.

Related-Bug: #1940568

Exclude neutron from venv constraints

Neutron itself appears in u-c for stable branches so we must filter
it out.

commit_message:
Add config for password policy, audit and motd

This change basically takes a number of dashboard configuration
options which are managed via `ceph dasboard key value` and
exposes them as charm config options.

Change-Id: I92e0948e36f4156686c908f86b5e2398b504a742

commit_message:
Bump os-resource-classes lib to 1.1.0

Newer version provides access to packet rate related resource classes:

* NET_PACKET_RATE_KILOPACKET_PER_SEC
* NET_PACKET_RATE_EGR_KILOPACKET_PER_SEC
* NET_PACKET_RATE_IGR_KILOPACKET_PER_SEC

Related-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: I505911412fd903d351f39ebb733ef8e872cb16fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-24 19:51:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add deployed_ceph feature

Add cli-deployed-ceph.yaml playbook which can be used
to deploy ceph after networkv2 is configured but before
the overcloud is configured.

Add the tripleo_cephadm_deployed_ceph parameter boolean
paramter which should be true if only if Ceph has already
been deployed.

This parameter causes the roles tripleo_run_cephadm and
tripleo_cephadm to skip certain tasks under the assmption
that these tasks have already been completed during an
earlier phase of deployment.

Change-Id: Id32f1135c857eb4ccc4a6c7356957ff0f5182839
(cherry picked from commit 35e455ad52751ae334a614a03c8257da2f30e038)
'}]
commit_message:
Add deployed_ceph feature

Add cli-deployed-ceph.yaml playbook which can be used
to deploy ceph after networkv2 is configured but before
the overcloud is configured.

Add the tripleo_cephadm_deployed_ceph parameter boolean
paramter which should be true if only if Ceph has already
been deployed.

This parameter causes the roles tripleo_run_cephadm and
tripleo_cephadm to skip certain tasks under the assmption
that these tasks have already been completed during an
earlier phase of deployment.

Change-Id: Id32f1135c857eb4ccc4a6c7356957ff0f5182839
(cherry picked from commit 35e455ad52751ae334a614a03c8257da2f30e038)

commit_message:
Restrict amqp indirect dep to speed up pip resolution

Pip is slow to resolve version constraints with many unrestricted
dependencies. The recent slowness seems to be due to amqp is being
unrestricted and pip starts with amqp 5.0.3 but the real minimum is
somewhere around amqp 2.5.0. This patch adds amqp 2.5.0 to
lower-constraints to speed up the pip version resolution.

Change-Id: Icd0a304fc989c9535db125cd483ecac92deb011d

(1 comment)

This change redefines what HostStatus.MAINTENANCE means. Today it means the compute service is disabled (regardless of its status) but after this patch it will mean the service is disable but up. Unfortunately the HostStatus is visible on our REST API[1] so such change of meaning could break a client depending on the value returned from our API. 

Can we create a fix that only fixes our internal checks but does not redefine the meaning of the HostStatus in our API response?

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=show-server-details-detail#id30'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-08-04 12:54:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

> This change redefines what HostStatus.MAINTENANCE means. Today it means the compute service is disabled (regardless of its status) but after this patch it will mean the service is disable but up. Unfortunately the HostStatus is visible on our REST API[1] so such change of meaning could break a client depending on the value returned from our API. 
> 
> Can we create a fix that only fixes our internal checks but does not redefine the meaning of the HostStatus in our API response?
> 
> [1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=show-server-details-detail#id30

Ah! I totally missed this was returned in the API, I'll move this into check_instance_host for now and line up another change where I rework the meaning of HostStatus.MAINTENANCE behind a microversion to avoid breaking anyone unintentionally."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-08-04 13:36:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-08-04 14:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2021-07-26 14:41:46.000000000', 'message': 'WIP compute: Do not mark disabled but down services as in maintenance

Change-Id: I45fd908b458e00b5e18848f624043ceb88b04825
'}, {'created': '2021-07-28 19:42:10.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Do not mark disabled but down services as in maintenance

Previously get_instance_host_status would return a HostStatus of
MAINTENANCE for all services marked as disabled. This however would lead
to callers such as check_instance_host incorrectly determining that the
host was available to receive admin requests, such as cold migrations to
drain the disabled host.

This change corrects this behaviour by ensuring a HostStatus of
MAINTENANCE is only returned by get_instance_host_status when the
underlying service is also reported as up via the service group API,
thus ensuring admin requests such as cold migrations can proceed.

Closes-Bug: #1938326
Change-Id: I45fd908b458e00b5e18848f624043ceb88b04825
'}, {'created': '2021-08-04 11:38:24.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Do not mark disabled but down services as in maintenance

Previously get_instance_host_status would return a HostStatus of
MAINTENANCE for all services marked as disabled. This however would lead
to callers such as check_instance_host incorrectly determining that the
host was available to receive admin requests, such as cold migrations to
drain the disabled host.

This change corrects this behaviour by ensuring a HostStatus of
MAINTENANCE is only returned by get_instance_host_status when the
underlying service is also reported as up via the service group API,
thus ensuring admin requests such as cold migrations can proceed.

Closes-Bug: #1938326
Change-Id: I45fd908b458e00b5e18848f624043ceb88b04825
'}, {'created': '2021-08-05 09:38:07.000000000', 'message': 'compute: Query the service group API within check_instance_host

The check_instance_host decorator when called with the check_is_up kwarg
is supposed to ensure that the host associated with a given instance is
fully up. Previously it used the HostStatus returned by
get_instance_host_status to determine this allowing either a state of UP
or MAINTENANCE.

However get_instance_host_status currently returns a HostStatus of
MAINTENANCE if the service is simply disabled regardless of the
underlying service being active or not. As a result of this and as set
out in bug #1938326 the check_instance_host decorator will pass allowing
calls to resize an instance to continue and later fail when RPC requests
to the instance host eventually fail.

To resolve this check_instance_host is now updated to only use the
service group API to determine if the underlying service is up.

There appears to be no unit tests for this decorator so all of the
validation here is done in the functional regression test for bug
 #1938326.

Future work will look at updating the meaning of the MAINTENANCE
HostStatus to mean disabled but up. As this will potentially
change values returned in the API to admins doing an instance show this
will need to be done behind a new microversion to ensure backward
compatibility with the previous behaviour and meaning of the HostStatus.

Closes-Bug: #1938326
Change-Id: I45fd908b458e00b5e18848f624043ceb88b04825

commit_message:
compute: Query the service group API within check_instance_host

The check_instance_host decorator when called with the check_is_up kwarg
is supposed to ensure that the compute service associated with a given
instance is fully up. Previously it used the HostStatus returned by
get_instance_host_status to determine this allowing either a state of UP
or MAINTENANCE.

However get_instance_host_status currently returns a HostStatus of
MAINTENANCE if the service is simply disabled regardless of the
underlying service being active or not. As a result of this and as set
out in bug #1938326 the check_instance_host decorator will pass allowing
calls to resize an instance to continue and later fail when RPC requests
to the instance host eventually fail.

To resolve this check_instance_host is now updated to only use the
service group API to determine if the underlying service is up.

Future work will look at updating the meaning of the MAINTENANCE
HostStatus to mean disabled but up. As this will potentially
change values returned in the API to admins doing an instance show this
will need to be done behind a new microversion to ensure backward
compatibility with the previous behaviour and meaning of the HostStatus.

Closes-Bug: #1938326
Change-Id: I45fd908b458e00b5e18848f624043ceb88b04825

commit_message:
Support Images API v2.11

Glance has changed the format of the cinder URIs in image locations
so that they can look like
   cinder://glance-store-name/volume_id
in addition to the legacy format
   cinder://volume_id

Change the cinder code so that it can handle both formats for
reading.  (We only need to write the legacy format.)

Change-Id: I8c176bf4c875061591bb6c94654a2cef643a4dcb
Closes-bug: #1898075

(2 comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-24 19:56:14.000000000', 'message': "Reproduce bug 1941005

We don't update instance.request_spec when we resize to a new flavor.
If the flavor's extra specs change, this is not reflected in
instance.request_spec.

This generally goes unnoticed when *adding* stuff to an instance. The
scheduler will still find a host based on the old request spec. The
resource claim on the destination uses the flavor and image data
directly (not the request spec) so the claim will correctly fail if
the destination does not have the new things that the instance wants.

When *removing* stuff form an instance this becomes problematic. The
scheduler will attempt to schedule based on the old request spec,
which could end up with NoValidHost if no host exists that has the
*old* stuff the instance wanted, despite the new flavor not wanting
any of that stuff.

Related bug: 1941005

Change-Id: I8c052a6526819834d79d2b5027050f1bdf36638f
"}]
commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1941005

We don't update instance.request_spec when we resize to a new flavor.
If the flavor's extra specs change, this is not reflected in
instance.request_spec.

This generally goes unnoticed when *adding* stuff to an instance. The
scheduler will still find a host based on the old request spec. The
resource claim on the destination uses the flavor and image data
directly (not the request spec) so the claim will correctly fail if
the destination does not have the new things that the instance wants.

When *removing* stuff form an instance this becomes problematic. The
scheduler will attempt to schedule based on the old request spec,
which could end up with NoValidHost if no host exists that has the
*old* stuff the instance wanted, despite the new flavor not wanting
any of that stuff.

Related bug: 1941005

Change-Id: I8c052a6526819834d79d2b5027050f1bdf36638f

Change-Id: Ib884be6aa12bd0d3faf83f3e753f8e7aad503b68

commit_message:
Use elevated context when getting default SG for tenant

With new scopes, when e.g. project admin context is used to ensure
default SG for different tenant, elevated context needs to be used
to make db query. Otherwise default SG will not be found and attempt to
create it in DB may fail with DuplicateDbEntry error.

Closes-Bug: #1938910
Change-Id: Ib884be6aa12bd0d3faf83f3e753f8e7aad503b68
(cherry picked from commit e6c3686cd8f863c49b363504dacdb7641604a102)

I'm no oslo_db expert but it looks good to me. One question though: why do we suddenly need to inherit from glance.tests.utils.BaseTestCase?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-07-29 09:19:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> I'm no oslo_db expert but it looks good to me. One question though: why do we suddenly need to inherit from glance.tests.utils.BaseTestCase?

We need to inherit from _a_ base class. The other classes there are mixins as opposed to something derived from unittest.TestCase. I could also use oslotest's BaseTestCase, but I had a look at other tests in glance.tests.functional.db and this was the first base test class I spotted 😄

Let me know if I need to change anything here"}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-07-29 16:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I am good with using glance tests base class.
Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-08-25 09:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

lgtm'}]

commit_message:
tests: Remove use of 'oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base'

The various test cases and mixins in 'oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base' have
been deprecated since oslo.db 4.34.0 (March 2018). Remove use of these.

Change-Id: I6618366e6464d569a86fb027919be2e1825e438c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
db: Reorder initial migration

Place the creation of initial records last, simply to provide some kind
of logical structure.

Change-Id: I6aa5a84c746c585d4b5f5d7e1092150bbf41e48a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Get rid of deprecated xml.etree.cElementTree

xml.etree.cElementTree is deprecated since Python 3.3 and shows
the following warning.

DeprecationWarning: defusedxml.cElementTree is deprecated, import from
defusedxml.ElementTree instead.

Change-Id: I86bdefc7e59d1be540aae047c6b27fdcedf416ad

commit_message:
Update code to Jinja 3.0 style

Xena cycle uses Jinja 3.0 so let update Kolla's code for it.

From Jinja2 documentation:

jinja2.contextfunction(f: F) → F
    Pass the context as the first argument to the decorated function.
    Deprecated since version 3.0: Will be removed in Jinja 3.1. Use pass_context() instead.

jinja2.contextfilter(f)
    Pass the context as the first argument to the decorated function.
    Deprecated since version 3.0: Will be removed in Jinja 3.1. Use pass_context() instead.

Also bumped version in requirements.txt to same as in openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I51fbb7b9ff7c29cb355437efa4576be9bc035699

[{'created': '2021-08-13 09:43:19.000000000', 'message': "[Puppet OpenStack] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I84f669944e427095301e331933320f4afd9fb069
"}]
commit_message:
[Puppet OpenStack] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I84f669944e427095301e331933320f4afd9fb069

[openstack-chef] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I50b1eb9a9b392db766f6699f01cdc89caf7b3630

[kolla] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Ib44378aa7c3b73ecfe00b615b8ef7860fece09b5

[{'created': '2021-07-16 23:40:49.000000000', 'message': "[freezer-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: Ieab529798e0e456663b8b576b654d670ecb4cf56
"}]
commit_message:
[freezer-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: Ieab529798e0e456663b8b576b654d670ecb4cf56

commit_message:
[storlets] Transition Newton to Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Newton branch and the Ocata branch to End of Life.
The last patch of these branch will be tagged with *-eol tag. Theese
branchs cannot be used anymore and will be deleted if this patch
merges.

This is needed as these branches are not actively maintained in
the recent period and thus gate is broken due to job failures.
By removing these branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Change-Id: I93822aa5fd9a1dde6b8226b4bc48adbc8093c28b

commit_message:
fix: Fix make build failed

Since poetry 1.1.8 version introduces a large number of bugs[1], which
makes the process of building container image fail, so the 1.1.8
version of poetry is not used.

[1] https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues/4429

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-05 09:04:55.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I5f8ed2d6b1ca8c26d7fafd280b135554ed597e99
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I5f8ed2d6b1ca8c26d7fafd280b135554ed597e99

commit_message:
feature: Add x-openstack-request-id into header

1. Add x-openstack-request-id into header
Let the skyline API continue to pass down with Request ID using for tracking chain.
It contributes to find the problem preliminarily.

Change-Id: Ib7f7dcc98183aa99a00fc69b73eba53d87642502

commit_message:
Fix upload-artifacts and its installation

Fix the content of DeployArtifactFILEs in the generated
environment file. The absolute path of the artifact is
now properly formatted, and the script correctly handles
multiple files passed in parameters.

Fix the installation of the script in setup.cfg.

Tested manually with multiple artifacts, and via
upload-puppet-modules (single artifact).

Change-Id: I946df38ada9b2197076963e6140653f85d7c2cbc
Closes-Bug: #1933336
(cherry picked from commit 7428219d9f6904970b9024680f1b0c331a26b36a)

which required permissions changes. This targets the entire
temporary directory recursively.

commit_message:
Nova: Remove useless authtoken hieradata from computes

The change e677aeacd706674762751f8b530ad08d6d925910 added authtoken
parameters to nova-compute because nova::metadata was added to
the compute class, but that inclusion was removed later by another
commit 287b1b6ce77fe143d781ccd1b900c3bdbe6ada87 .

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/762415
Change-Id: I73978fcf2e4261d9ab2b1ceaee8bc0dd2b1ae10f
(cherry picked from commit fcac503da3fd293542316096a5049051d8d0839f)

commit_message:
Enable debug of memcached when Debug is enabled

This restores the previous behavior changed by recent refactoring about
the *Debug parameters, and ensures that the global Debug parameter also
affects memcached logging.

Closes-Bug: #1940303
Change-Id: I5b8c71793476dd7673015928254d8fa8b499351d
(cherry picked from commit 073e581e62b961ce1e4871e74c9717dd34673c8c)

commit_message:
fup: Remove unused legacy block_device_info format

As announced on the ML [1] this change removes the now unused legacy format
from the codebase and updates the reference docs.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-August/024116.html

Change-Id: I3895b61b436b9bb882477d2d1b3f4907f03b3b1c

commit_message:
Use Block Storage API v3 instead of API v2

Block Storage API v2 was deprecated during Pike cycle and is being
removed during Xena cycle, and current v3 API should be used instead.
Unused volume_client and network_client in integration test code are
also removed by this change.

Note:
granade tests is made non-voting temporally until the same issue is
fixed in stable/victoria.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/802150/
Change-Id: I6a2b5afa13480791971bbd8bba1f43b9f2db8294
(cherry picked from commit 1828df32fa946d49d8449ff1d8a26c05b3990a65)
(cherry picked from commit 8fbd4476c00565c38ff341e639cee5cbdf83f0f9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-16 09:23:53.000000000', 'message': 'Release final cliff for Xena

This proposed a release for cliff to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 23.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 3.8.0..734bc0c
8fa916e Colourise and automatically page help output
9b66f40 Update unit test to satisfy python3.10+
392f3b2 Handle SIGPIPE exit gracefully
452fff3 Add conflict_handler parameter as attribut in Command class

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I044ea7a8cd9de0e6b467a8c1c751555cb4961569
'}]
commit_message:
Release final cliff for Xena

This proposed a release for cliff to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 23.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 3.8.0..734bc0c
8fa916e Colourise and automatically page help output
9b66f40 Update unit test to satisfy python3.10+
392f3b2 Handle SIGPIPE exit gracefully
452fff3 Add conflict_handler parameter as attribut in Command class

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I044ea7a8cd9de0e6b467a8c1c751555cb4961569

commit_message:
feature: Add ZUUL JOBs

1. Add `skyline-tox-functional-py38` job to execute unit tests
2. Add `skyline-tox-lint-py38` job to execute code static analysis

Change-Id: I6ee8e89e72b3769a2803f8dc2a7b7a434f16e16f

commit_message:
Release final osc-lib for Xena

This proposed a release for osc-lib to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, August 23.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.4.1..415a6c7
4c3d3a0 Moving IRC network reference to OFTC
e3f58c1 Correct the tox option for skipping sdist generation

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5b43120f291a14e0c37f8fcb9199947399f6e5f5

commit_message:
fix get share access rules failed

in manila-ui, when we want to get share detail.
it will try to get share access rules.

/v2/shares/{share_id}/action
List access rules (DEPRECATED)

This API is deprecated starting with microversion 2.45 and requests to
this API will fail with a 404 starting from microversion 2.45.Use List
share access rules API instead of this API from version 2.45.

/v2/share-access-rules?share_id={share-id}
List share access rules

Change-Id: Ie186cd071b45f37988384d6486dbe9b78520614c

commit_message:
Fix multinode-ipa job from building-test-packages twice

In the downstream  multinode-ipa job, undercloud-setup
get called twice and it is affacting bug[1].
This patch fixes the build-test-packages not to run twice
by putting a when clause and it will close bug[1].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1994848

Change-Id: Ia79a9000af2ef6b65d997af2e1224139ceb6fed7
